Ratings.comment: Marc is great, anyone who tells you his classes are bad or extremely hard most likely has severe CTE or should not have passed the second grade. Best organized course in Fisher if not the entire school. Marc and his courses are extremely consistent and you should know what you are getting yourself into with him.

The three exams in this class are extremely difficult. Questions would be a problem you have never seen before. Actual lectures are all prerecorded. He does not really care to teach his students but rather collect a check. Weekly quizzes were the only thing that kept me from failing.

Sometimes I wish Fisher was like elementary school where you have one teacher and that I could have Marc for every class. He teaches the subject well, the class is very organized (better than any other bus core I've had), and is hilarious.

Honestly you either get accounting or you don't. Watch his lecture videos, go to class, and do the homework even though it isn't graded. Tests can be annoying since no partial create is given but still not too bad. Honestly really liked him and how class is organized. Also curve at the end.
Pretty good professor but his course is horribly organized by just very hard exams.
Marc is the goat. You just have to do the work. If you are self-disciplined enough then you will genuinely learn the material here to the fullest. Go to the lectures!
man gave me grey hair

Marc is an absolute legend and one of my favorite teachers I've ever had. The class is extremely organized. Everything you are tested over is in his provided slides or practice problems. He is very funny and has a dry sense of humor. The "lectures" are self paced online. They go through problems in class and in recitation. This man is famous.

Marc Smith is a hilarious and talented professor. I know people aren't fans of his teaching style, but I think he's the best professor out there. Don't overestimate your knowledge and skip the homework's, you'll definitely get hit hard on the tests. He does a good job of explaining the content in detail and his homework is good for test review!

Found the class to be much tougher concept wise than 1, which I pulled an A in. Only way to succeed in the class is doing the homework on top of everything, and going to Marc's office hours. Really want to give Marc a 2 because the class is so tough, but he's such a good teacher and a super nice guy 1 on 1. Don't start lazy if you did well in 1.
Marc is a great professor, but the class is just hard. You MUST do all the homeworks in order to succeed. The key to this class is persistence and discipline.

Definitely a harder class compared to 2200, but the class is still extremely well organized and keeps out of class work to a minimum. His lectures and recitations work the same way they did for 2200, and I think both are very well utilized.

The celebrity of Fisher. 2300 is more abstract problem solving and LOTS of formulas; check your quizzes with TAs and keep a solid study schedule mainly for Exams 2&3. He's a great explainer and hilarious; what hasn't already been said besides not wearing bright colors or sitting by steps? Long Live Betty DeRose, Inc.!

Marc is the best lecturer I've had at Fisher thus far. He is super knowledgeable and the class's structure is easy to follow. If you put in the effort, you will succeed in this class. I would say there is way more memorization in this course than in ACCTMIS 2200. If you need help, go to the tutor room.

Marc is the goat. His two intro accounting classes are what made me want to switch from a finance major to an accounting major. Very organized classes, engaging lectures, and helpful TAs. Accounting is hard, but if you put in the work you will get results

I thought that Marc was a great professor. I liked the structure of the class where the you watched his online videos before class, and then he walks through a problem in class which was super useful. The exams also were "precurved," and the final grade is also curved.. The only negative I could see with him is the cold calling he does.

Love this guy! He tells you what you need to know and not much more. He has the best TAs in Fisher and he's funny if you get his dry sense of humor. DO THE HOMEWORK and you'll be fine. They say accounting majors do better in ACCT2200 and worse in ACCT 2300 which is inverse for everyone else. I definitely had this experience.

This is a total weed out class. You have to work way harder on this class compared to all your others and it may still not be enough. Test averages were about 67%. Wayyyy too hard for no reason, cares more about tricking you rather than seeing what you know.
Me personally I found this class difficult due to his exams. Besides that his lectures and quizzes are pretty manageable. Marc is a good teacher who explains things pretty clearly.
Watch the lectures and do the homework/practice exams and you'll be fine. This class isn't nearly as bad as people make it out to be. Marc is a good teacher.

I would say it is not fair that attendance have 20% of all. I tried so hard and I got 94% of my final exam. However, my grade changes from 88.05% to 88.55% only. I am so disappointed. Just because I couldn't get a word in during class discussions, my attendance score is only 80%. So my final exam grade seems to be so meaningless.

Andrea Wiltrout is the best professor in the Fisher College of Business. She really cares about her students and it shows in the way she leads. Read the textbook before class and make a comprehensive cheat sheet for the exams. Put in an honest effort and you will do great! Engage in discussions and be open to share, it'll make participation fun!

Professor Wiltrout is a really engaging lecturer especially if you have some interest in law. Her class grade is majorly determined by the midterm and final. However, if you do the readings and pay attention in class they are not too bad. Additionally, she allows each student to have a cheat sheet so no worry about memorizing a lot of terms.
One of the best professors I have had at Ohio State, HIGHLY recommend!

Professor Wiltrout was a nice, knowledgable professor that had pretty solid lectures. Your grade is basically based all upon two exams, so the homework assignments don't do much for your grade. The exams weren't terrible, but definitely were not a cake walk. YOU MUST PARTICIPATE IN CLASS.

This professor is new to teaching Business Law but I highly recommend her. She cares about your participation but the topics are quite interesting and they often spark questions anyways. I did very well on the midterm and average on the final and somehow still ended with a B+.

Professor Wiltrout is a new professor who teaches BUSFIN3500. Wiltrout is enthuisastic and understanding. The class concepts in the class aren't extremely challenging but it can be a lot because most people aren't proficient in law. Attendance wasn't technically mandatory, but there was a grade for overall participation. I recommend taking her.

Prof. Wiltrout taught her first semester at OSU in Spring 23 and was exceptional; she was very engaged in lecture and tried to simplify tougher legal business concepts by being enthusiastic and making good examples during class; exams were no harder or easier than an average core class but you do get a cheat sheet during the exams; highly recommend

I have never had an issue with a Professor in my 4 years at Ohio State until I took a class with Marissa Nelson. She is extremely rude and condescending to students asking questions in class. She does not act as a Professor who wants her students to succeed. I strongly suggest looking elsewhere if you value feeling respected by your Professor.

Frequently changes the schedule and blames the students when there are conflicts. Will not curve exams if only one person gets 100%, regardless of the actual average. Does not prepare students for exams very well. Practice is solved differently than taught in class. Lectures are okay.

She was by far the worst professor I have ever taken a class with in my entire life.I did not learn a single thing from her during class time and had to teach myself everything. In addition to being a bad professor she is also extremely rude and flat out mean! I would avoid taking any classes with her at all costs. Don't subject yourself to her.

She always asked if we had questions over anything during lecture. Class had a few group tax projects (which are easy if you make sure to follow the instructions) and open-note exams. Content could sometimes be a bit dry, but Marissa was great and we usually got out a little early. I'd definitely recommend her for this class.

Prof. Nelson was very personable and was willing to answer any questions. There were several group projects, but you can work in class and she is willing to check answers, which essentially guarantees an A. Having a solid understanding how to do the projects and homework is key to doing well on her exams. Overall, a really great teacher!

I took tax 2 and financial 3 with her over the summer. Both classes are project based but she gives you plenty of time in class for you to ask questions and if you actively work you almost always get atleast an A on the projects. The exams/quizzes can be challenging but open note so just read and youll be good. She is super caring and a great prof

This class is difficult, but Professor Nelson is great at teaching. If you have a solid group for workpapers, they will never be a problem. The tests are exactly the same as the homework. Hard class but a great professor with no surprises.

Lectures were very boring and usually did not go over information that was needed for the test. The work papers were often helpful but hard. Tests were very hard and she did not give us an overview of what would be on there. Do not take financial 2 with her! she will not do you any favors
This class was definitely challenging, but Nelson would be willing to help after class hours.

Lecture notes were often not applicable to questions on the test. Often skipped examples during lecture that would help students for the tests. Rarely gave good study materials for exams so went into tests blind which caused bad test grades. Expected students to know a general overview for pop quizzes but took points off for small wording errors.

Decent for Financial 2. Class was unorganized and she changed the syllabus during the semester. I felt the best way to succeed was to not attend her lectures because the material she went over went too beyond what was tested. Watching her online module's and mastering the slides will help you succeed on the exams. The material can get difficult

She is a great professor and a kind person all around. The only downside is a lot of group projects (50% of your final grade). But she offers workshop days to work on the project in class and she offers support outside of class if you ask. She really wants everyone to succeed.
Worst accounting teacher I have ever seen. She can't explain things. And she gives us a 78 pages final projects, which is insane.

Ms. Nelson was one of my favorite teachers at OSU. I had her for Tax 1 and Tax 2 for the accounting major. She is very understanding and has a fun personality. You will need to read the textbook but her exams are very fair and offers a lot of help on the projects she gives. Highly recommend taking her class.

Here comes a real review. Truthfully not too bad, and lectures were not boring either. But I didnt like how the grading was set and I didnt feel thats fair. Pop quiz significant hurts the grade. The averages for exams were under 70 but she only curved 3%. Ended up with B+ but I was able to get 4 As with Marc Smith!
prof Nelson is pretty average instructor. Class is manageable if you put in the effort. Fair grader, funny professor, like someone youd want to hang with in the real world. Would take again
She was captivating and I had no problem paying attention in class. I usually doze off in earlier classes, but she did a really good job.
Tough but fair. Not the hardest class Ive taken but its not something you can glide through
She's what you expect from a college level teacher. You are gonna have to put in a good level of effort. Don't expect to not show up and do well, but she's fair.

If you're looking to just bum your way through class and expect her to be one of those professors to change your grade to an A at the last minute, she is not for you. I saw so many peers in this class expect this then get mad when she says no. You will work in her class, don't get me wrong. But she is always willing to help and cares deeply

Did you know that Dr. Roulstone used to teach at the University of Chicago's Booth School of Business? If not, then you didn't take his class because that's all he talks about. Other than the non-stop Chicago reminiscing, class wasn't too bad and was pretty easy. Basically a repeat of undergrad intermediate financial except with Roulstone's book.
Best prof in Fisher! I will remember Kathy forever! Love Kathy❤️

Professor Wantuch was genuinely so amazing to have for this course. I hate exams but her exams are all based off of the slides. I remember seeing so many of the lecture problems on the exam, so study for the exams this way. My exam scores increased like 10% after changing to study for the exams this way.

Amazing professor. She makes hard content easy and managable to understand. It's not an easy class to get an A because there are exams that test on a lot of material. But is a class that if you genuinely try, you will do well. Amazing structure. Geninuely don't think I have learned so much peacefully.
Kathy is a great teacher! She does a really good job explaining tough material. She is by far the best accounting teacher I have had and probably;y one of the best teachers at this school.

I was worried coming into this class with a B+ in both intermediate financial classes, but Prof. Wantuch is SO good at explaining difficult concepts from the textbook into something cohesive. As long as you can do the homework, you will have no problem with the class. I wish I had her for my earlier accounting courses.

Such a well laid-out and organized class! So glad I took it with Professor Wantuch. Her lectures are clear, concise, and give you the exact information you need for the exams. She is very kind as well and clearly wants her students to succeed. I'd love to take another class with her.

Amazing professor. The grades for this class included a lot of participation and homework assignments. There was two exams a midterm and a final that counted for about 50% of the grade (25% each). Then about 10% was attendance and participation. The rest of the 40% was homework assignments. She was willing to help outside of class even over email.
Great professor, would take again in. heartbeat
Great professor. Tests are exactly what you think they are and she really breaks down the concepts. Wish I had her in my earlier classes

Highly recommend her for this class. She explains concepts very well and will be happy to meet with you to discuss any problems. Read the book, since the lecture notes are based on it. Tests are somewhat challenging but if you keep up with the lectures and re-do problems from lectures you'll be fine.

I learned so much from Professor Wantuch. Her lectures were so informational and her material was challenging but very achievable if you put in the time and effort. She is awesome if you really want to learn accounting. One of the best professors I have had!!
Great professor, explains things so well in class. Homework can be tough but you get multiple tries. Really feel like I learned so much in this class

One of my favorite professors at OSU. I took her in the Fall of 2020. Right now, I studying to take the FAR portion of the CPA Exam. All of her questions match what you'll see in the Becker FAR review. So many topics in this class are present on the FAR exam and study material. I highly recommend taking this class with her!
Best Accounting professor teaching 3200. Take her class if you can.

Definitely take Professor Wantuch whenever possible, she is the best accounting professor I have had at Ohio State. I took financial accounting 1 with her and she explained tough concepts really well and always looked our for her students. HW and participation are half of the grade, rest exams. She is the best!

She is one of the BEST professors I've ever had in Fisher. I have taken her financial accounting 1 and tax 2 and I love her every lecture. The handout is extremely useful and ppt is also clear. She transfers hard stuff to something easier to understand and master.

This is the best tip I can give you for her class: Any problem that you see in class/on the online homeworks will likely show up again *nearly word for word* on the exams. Keep detailed notes on exactly how she does the in class problems that she prints out for everyone and you will do great on the exams.
Very well organized professor with clear lectures, which makes it easy to do well in the class! I highly recommend Tax 2 with professor Wantuch, I personally think it is easier than Tax 1.

A real gem. Very responsive to emails. Very helpful in class. Lectures that actually make sense. Exam heavy, but what's on the lecture is tested. Solid experience. She has a bit of bravado in her ways but don't let that scare you. A real golden asset to the OSU Accounting dept. You'll have to work for the grade, but she's fair.

Kathy relies heavily on the textbook. The homework is from the book, the powerpoints use a lot of snapshots from the book, the exams are questions from the book. Study the BOOK. She curves each exam as you go, usually the curve is based on the results of the first exam. She is a nice lady, just doesn't have the experience to create her own material

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH PARTRIDGE. He doesn't give any exam review material, doesn't post any of his notes or lectures from class, and is not engaging at all. Do everything in your power to take this class with a different professor. One bad test and your grade is done for.

Clay was funny and sarcastic but definitely a difficult class. 75% of the grade is exams and each are 25 questions so if you get one wrong, that's one percent off your final grade. If you aren't a great exam taker, I wouldn't recommend taking him but he does a good job of teaching the material.

Do NOT take this professor. His exams are so hard and the averages are like Ds. His lectures are often confusing and he contradicts himself so many times. He's a weird teacher overall who thinks that going over exams are unnecessary. I learned more from the textbook than from him. (the textbook is optional but it saved my grade on the last exam)
If you need to take this course, plz take another professor.
"You can look over your exams, but if you do, I'm going to think differently of you."
PY the goat. - 3300H was not an option lol

Pointlessly difficult and tedious. I got good grades, read the textbook, actively participated, asked questions, etc. This class really isn't worth it if you're not an accounting/finance/econ major. His own understanding of a lot of these concepts is tenuous at best (case in point, when he struggles and stumbles over explaining linear regression)

The hardest class I've taken at OSU, but it was well worth the struggle because I felt that I understood accounting at a deeper level instead of just memorizing information for an exam. This class is brutally hard not for the faint of heart.

Incredibly difficult class, not something to take lightly. If you are committed, ready to study and bring your best thinking game, you will do well. If you try to mosey through this class, you'll fail or drop. Saw some smart students get crushed because they were unmotivated. Professor Young is a good guy, fair but strict. Top tier education.

Some materials are fairly interesting. However, the class has a heavy work load and tough exams. I spent at least 4-5 hours of prep before every class.   He is that kind of professor, who, after seeing terrible comments on his SEIs, unchecks "allow comments" box in his SEI settings the next year.  Brilliant.

Great professor. Makes you think and won't spell everything out for you in class. You have a partner to do homework with, which is great to bounce ideas off of and think things through. Definitely teaches you how to think analytically. Take the class and work hard.

He is really a helpful and knowledgable professor that you can learn a lot from his class. Even though everyone has to spend a lot of time on homework, he only cares about how much you learnt by doing homework. So it is ok you hand in a homework that you did really bad.

Truly not as bad as it is made out to be. You will spend A LOT of time on homework. Everyone struggles but you'll get more out of it than normal accounting. Whether you want to do the honors accounting program or not, this will help set you up for classes to come (331, 620 etc.) Can't get lower than a B.

The beginning of the class seems unbearable, but IT IS EXTREMELY WORTH IT.  The class gets better as you go along.  You will spend alot of time on homework and studying, but as you get more familiar with him and the class, it ends up being enjoyable (yet still a little stressful).  He is not nearly as bad as people say.

Rick Young's a nice guy, albeit intimidating at first. Be prepared to work 15+ hours a week on HW, reading and studying. Make sure you get a good partner the first day of class. This class is brutal. I think the book is intended to be used for graduate studies... so... yeah. Don't fall behind. Participate. The avg. grade is fairly lenient (A-).
If he likes you, you'll get an A. He may look at your tests before giving you a final grade, he may not.

A very challenging class, with very high level material.  However it was very rewarding with Prof Young, as he pushes students to think critically and problem-solve.  He has high expectations, and a lot of work must be done for each class.  Prof Young is extremely knowledgeable and passionate, overall a great instructor.
Not much to say besides avoid if you can unless you enjoy being lost in confused and then getting subtly insulted when you ask a question

Extremly difficult prof. Uses a book that is very hard to understand and he is not much help explaining it he is actually kind of a jerk if you don't know what's going on expects you to know everything that's going on and acts confused when ppl don't automatically know everthing from just reading the book. I would avoid him if you can
Professor Young is a great professor. He encourages you to think and he answers your questions. So as long as you work hard, you will learn a lot from this class and get a great grade in the end.

If you like to teach yourself from a book that "clarifies" difficult concepts by explaining them with variables like x1, x2 and x3, then take this class. Otherwise, AVOID. He isn't helpful and expects you to teach yourself everything. His tests are extremely difficult. I've learned a lot from difficult profs before, but nothing from him.

He might be ok for an honors student, but not for me. This is a non honors class but taught like an honors class. If you had someone besides Fellingham, don't take this.  Very different than the 212 I took with Mulchandani. I am going to end up dropping this class (I have never dropped a class before). I strongly recommend AGAINST him if possible.

He wasn't as bad as the comments made him out to be.  He might be a little snarky at times, but he's pretty cool. Make sure you stay on top of your homework, because you'll cover a lot of material over the quarter.

Great professor-His goal is to make you work as hard as possible, and he accomplishes it. Probably not for some, but I like knowing that I can survive a heavy workload. A lot more helpful than you'd  expect- he works harder than you at preparing for class. A bit quirky, but it's enjoyable. Recommended if ur not afraid of working hard. Not4slackers!
I don't get these reviews... I never did anything in this class, nor was I an accounting major, and got an easy A. It was much better than H212!
So bad already. They just be hiring anyone at this point. Reads off slides and doesn't teach.

A lot of these reviews surprise me. She was always very kind and willing to help any student. Her grades are very fair, even the exams are fair and what you learn in class is what is actually on the exam.

Despite a lot of the reviews on here, I had a very positive experience with Dr. Feustel. There is a lot of content covered in the course, so although attendance wasn't mandatory, I'd highly encourage that you miss as few classes as possible. You will succeed if you go to class and do the practice problems - she doesn't trick students!
Take 4200 with anyone else

She is one of those professors who will engage with you a lot if you start discussions in class. Most of the people in class stay quiet and do not ask questions, which I believe leads to their demise in their grades.

She's very enthusiastic about the material, and knows it all like the back of her hand, but her lectures were disorganized. Start reading the textbook as early as you can because the lectures are not very helpful in understanding the material. Practice problems don't really prepare you for quiz. She can be a little intimidating in office hours.

Overall, is a good professor. Gives lots of info on the slides, so if you know that, and how to do the practice problems, you should be fine. I came in with previous knowledge in tax, so I'm not sure if my experience with her would've been different if I had not.

Tough class. However, Professor Feustel does care about her students learning and is supportive. Clearly very knowledgable on the areas that she teaches. Class is pretty well organized. Professor is quick to respond to emails and flexible in meeting outside of class for students. Put in the effort, ask questions and you'll be fine.

I have to say she is a poor instructor! Tax is hard, but her class was harder! Her powerpoint lecture was so unorganized!! She just read everything on the PowerPoint quickly. There were many many many quizzes and assignments you have to do. Tons of Connect assignments and T-assignment. Her exams were hard too! The worst class I have ever taken!

I've taken both 4200 and 3400 with Prof Feustel. She's so nice, and cares a lot about her students. Both of the classes are difficult but manageable. She's great about being available to meet on Zoom to answer questions! I would definitely recommend taking her classes!

Professor Feustel is awesome and really cares about her students!! She clearly loves the subject she teaches (tax). Lots of hw and assignments but that helps w your grade significantly.  The only thing would be that the PowerPoint is not the best. The phase out and the exception are not stated and you have to read the long textbook for them.
Professor Feustel is tough but fair. The material for 4200 is difficult, but she puts in the time to help students understand and attend to different people's learning styles

Course material is not very organized. I know Tax is a lot of information and random rules, but she would often say exceptions to rules and ramble on without writing anything down. Powerpoints are not very organized either. Reading is basically mandatory to do well in this class. Cheat sheets on every exam, and lots of homework/quizzes/assignments.
DO NOT TAKE ADVANCED FIN WITH HER. Ridiculous amount of homework, be prepared to teach yourself.
Extremely difficult class with a very different teaching style and use of book that doesn't help at all. Plus additional case work that eats up valuable class time and could be spent on other things

Advanced Financial was a hard class, but she gives you what you need to succeed. She's a really nice person and cares about her students & if we're really getting the material. I only read the textbook for sections I was confused on, otherwise it's not necessary. If you put in the effort to actually understand and not just memorize, you'll do well.
I think her class and especially her powerpoints were very unorganized. Yeah I know tax is hard, but jeez, she has to deliver the material better. If you look around, most of the class is lost.

Tax is definitely a tough class, and while her exams were very difficult and she doesn't technically "curve," she does allow you to earn up to 10 points back after every exam (essentially up to a 10% bonus) with some make-up problems. She really cares about her students and is always available to help.

Excessive amount of work and incredibly hard to get decent grade even while putting in hours of work in. She is always available to answer questions and is very helpful when you go in to office hours.

Go to class and actually pay attention, read the textbook, and do your homework. Exams are very fair and you get to bring 2 pages of notes to use. Be thorough in your notes. No curve, but we've gotten up to 10 bonus points per exam (100 pt exam). She is very nice and funny and made tax as enjoyable as possible! You just have to put in the effort.

Marc Smith gets paid $200k+ a year to show up once a week and do a lecture, but he chill tho. If you don't watch the online lecture videos before class each week, good luck. It takes some time but if you set aside a block each week to lock in you'll be fine. Don't let the first exam grade scare you, theres a big curve at the end + the finals easy
The goat. I don't understand the hate, he does a great job teaching, and the exams are just like the homework and lecture problems there are no tricks or difficult questions on the exam.
Wonderful professor, wonderful class. Very organized and clear lectures. Learned a lot.
Hell yeah.
Horrible. take this class at toledo
His ego way too high for being mainly a freshman professor. Teach some more difficult classes buddy
If you pay attention you will be fine, everyone that does poorly in this class is just lazy and doesn't watch the videos

Marc is great, anyone who tells you his classes are bad or extremely hard most likely has severe CTE or should not have passed the second grade. Best organized course in Fisher if not the entire school. Marc and his courses are extremely consistent and you should know what you are getting yourself into with him.

The three exams in this class are extremely difficult. Questions would be a problem you have never seen before. Actual lectures are all prerecorded. He does not really care to teach his students but rather collect a check. Weekly quizzes were the only thing that kept me from failing.

Sometimes I wish Fisher was like elementary school where you have one teacher and that I could have Marc for every class. He teaches the subject well, the class is very organized (better than any other bus core I've had), and is hilarious.

Honestly you either get accounting or you don't. Watch his lecture videos, go to class, and do the homework even though it isn't graded. Tests can be annoying since no partial create is given but still not too bad. Honestly really liked him and how class is organized. Also curve at the end.
Pretty good professor but his course is horribly organized by just very hard exams.
Marc is the goat. You just have to do the work. If you are self-disciplined enough then you will genuinely learn the material here to the fullest. Go to the lectures!
man gave me grey hair

Marc is an absolute legend and one of my favorite teachers I've ever had. The class is extremely organized. Everything you are tested over is in his provided slides or practice problems. He is very funny and has a dry sense of humor. The "lectures" are self paced online. They go through problems in class and in recitation. This man is famous.

Marc Smith is a hilarious and talented professor. I know people aren't fans of his teaching style, but I think he's the best professor out there. Don't overestimate your knowledge and skip the homework's, you'll definitely get hit hard on the tests. He does a good job of explaining the content in detail and his homework is good for test review!

Found the class to be much tougher concept wise than 1, which I pulled an A in. Only way to succeed in the class is doing the homework on top of everything, and going to Marc's office hours. Really want to give Marc a 2 because the class is so tough, but he's such a good teacher and a super nice guy 1 on 1. Don't start lazy if you did well in 1.
Marc is a great professor, but the class is just hard. You MUST do all the homeworks in order to succeed. The key to this class is persistence and discipline.

Definitely a harder class compared to 2200, but the class is still extremely well organized and keeps out of class work to a minimum. His lectures and recitations work the same way they did for 2200, and I think both are very well utilized.

The celebrity of Fisher. 2300 is more abstract problem solving and LOTS of formulas; check your quizzes with TAs and keep a solid study schedule mainly for Exams 2&3. He's a great explainer and hilarious; what hasn't already been said besides not wearing bright colors or sitting by steps? Long Live Betty DeRose, Inc.!

Marc is the best lecturer I've had at Fisher thus far. He is super knowledgeable and the class's structure is easy to follow. If you put in the effort, you will succeed in this class. I would say there is way more memorization in this course than in ACCTMIS 2200. If you need help, go to the tutor room.

Marc is the goat. His two intro accounting classes are what made me want to switch from a finance major to an accounting major. Very organized classes, engaging lectures, and helpful TAs. Accounting is hard, but if you put in the work you will get results

I thought that Marc was a great professor. I liked the structure of the class where the you watched his online videos before class, and then he walks through a problem in class which was super useful. The exams also were "precurved," and the final grade is also curved.. The only negative I could see with him is the cold calling he does.

Love this guy! He tells you what you need to know and not much more. He has the best TAs in Fisher and he's funny if you get his dry sense of humor. DO THE HOMEWORK and you'll be fine. They say accounting majors do better in ACCT2200 and worse in ACCT 2300 which is inverse for everyone else. I definitely had this experience.

This is a total weed out class. You have to work way harder on this class compared to all your others and it may still not be enough. Test averages were about 67%. Wayyyy too hard for no reason, cares more about tricking you rather than seeing what you know.
Me personally I found this class difficult due to his exams. Besides that his lectures and quizzes are pretty manageable. Marc is a good teacher who explains things pretty clearly.
Watch the lectures and do the homework/practice exams and you'll be fine. This class isn't nearly as bad as people make it out to be. Marc is a good teacher.

I was very nervous about both of the Intro Accounting classes, but Marc is an overall good professor and does a very good job explaining the material. It does require a lot of studying and time to do very well in this class. I definitely recommend going to recitations, doing the homework, and practice tests for extra practice and studying.

10/10 class he organized it well there is not too much content to be overwhelming, but you do have to keep up. Every week you have a topic with videos/questions, the prof zoom/q's, the TA zoom/ q's, and hw. Do all of that every week and you'll get an A.

This is my fourth class with Marc and all I have to say is that it is imperative that you study. There's no way around it. Marc gets a lot of hate because the course material is difficult, but his teaching is great. He lays out everything you need to know in each lecture so there is no misunderstanding of expectations. Study a lot and you'll pass.

Marc is a very good professor, but be prepared in lectures for cold calling, he will single you out. The recitations are attendance mandatory, but genuinely help a lot. The exams are a little tough, but as long as you study you'll be fine. Just be sure you understand all the steps in their entirety.

This class is overrated on difficulty. I went in terrified but if you study for 20 a day, do the practice exams, and do the quizzes you will get a strong A. If you don't do those you will fail. Overall Marc is a great teacher who I would (and have) take again.

Marc's lectures are super helpful as he is so knowledgeable and I recommend using all the materials he gives to study for the 3 exams. Also, use the Tutor Room to get help and ask questions. I think he is the best lecturer I've had thus far in Fisher. This class is tough if you don't put in the effort but if you do the work, you should be okay.

There's genuinely 0 reason to not get an A in his class the exams r so light if u do the work. As long as u do what u came to college for…learn, you'll b chill. I wouldn't listen to ppl that say it's an awful class cus they prolly just failed and r salty. sit down put the phone away and take good notes on the videos and get an A not that hard

His class is tough - no question. His teachings have been so helpful in my future accounting classes though. His exams are passable and straightforward, but they will require studying and attending lectures and recitations. His videos can get boring, but will be very helpful in the end. I would love for all my courses to be set up the way his is.
Not a fan whatsoever

He is an amazing teacher! He made the material extremely accessible and the order of lectures and concepts is the perfect pace and as long as you can complete homework, exams are a breeze. Some HW questions I would be stuck on but if you can recall the steps of the problems and redo it, you're good to go! Def recommend going to recitation!
Marc is a good guy, but his lectures are very scary as he calls on random people throughout the class. Criteria for the course is very easy to follow. Go to tutoring, and you'll be just fine.

Professor Smith's 2200 class can be challenging, but his engaging lectures and ample study materials make it manageable. Utilize resources like TAs, practice exams, and unstuckstudy AI to succeed. Attendance is a must, but the workload is reasonable.

Marc is very knowledgeable about accounting and is genuinely interested in teaching. If you do not understand the video material, it is imperative to seek help with the tutors. The tutors help clarify questions and problems. This class is tough because you have to be accountable for the class work. There is only 9-10 grades for the entire class.
Marc Smith is an honest man. If you do the work, you will pass. However, if you don't watch the videos and get behind, it will negatively impact your grade significantly!

The lecture videos cover everything that could be on exams and quizzes, and he restates important topics over and over again so that you don't forget. If you watch the vids (double speed it he talks slow) and do the homework problems and practice exams, you will ace the class easily. Everything on exams is in the practice problems given.

I thought Marc was great. His lectures were very engaging and the material was straight forward. There is a lot of content to be studied and memorized, but the study materials are great and office hours with the TAs can be great.

I like the format of Marc's class. I think he teaches it well and the TA's are awesome. However, the class is graded solely on quizzes and exams. If you don't do well testing, forget an A. I think he is an awesome tecaher, but he could make some tweaks to make it a little easier. He does curve the grades a grade level (ex. B+ to A-)

Marc Smith is the GOAT. I don't care what anyone else has to say about him. You might hear his classes are really hard if you haven't taken one yet so you might feel scared a bit. His lectures are not mandatory but I still recommend going to all of those. Also, please watch all the videos before every class! If you don't you're gonna get behind

Accounting can be a very tricky and confusing topic, but Marc Smith really knows how to teach it correctly so that you will understand it. I had my worries before taking accounting based on what people said about the subject, but Marc makes it understandable and not as horrible as people make it out to be. 10/10 professor.

Lecture attendance is not required but recitation is. Make sure you watch the videos each week just so you know whats going on before lecture. Word of advice for lectures, if you sit in the front or wear a bright color you're gonna get cold called on in a lecture with hundreds of people. His tests have built in curves and he will add extra credit.

Honestly a great and enthusiastic professor. Lectures are online, but you HAVE to watch them if you want to do well, and DO NOT fall behind trust me. This class is difficult and a lot of work, but the TA's have literally been my saving grace, and I attribute my successes on my exams to the TA's in the tutor room. UTILIZE THEM TRUST ME.

If you watch the videos and attend class, it's not that hard. I remember hearing all sorts of negative things about him before taking 2200&2300, and none of the rumors are even remotely true. I think people just hate him because they're not putting in any effort to the class. Honestly, Marc made this class one of the easier business classes for me.

Not an accounting major so accounting is tough, I didnt find Marc Smith very helpful and I struggled, take my advice and use 405 Tutoring otherwise I dont know how people survive this class between all the homework, tests, etc.
As long as you watch the videos, take notes, and do the homework, you should be fine

Marc is such a great professor. No matter how bad people say he is, I have learned so much in his classes. The courses are very organized and he has very clear guidelines on how to be successful. As long as you keep up with the videos and do the homework problems and practice exams before the midterm and final, you will be fine. I highly recommend.

The entire course is three exams and quizzes that don't do much to help your grade. I recommend attending TA office hours if you struggle with equations because thats what this class is mostly about. He is very intelligent, but doesn't offer much room for error with the grades.

Luckily I passed, but this class brought me anxiety the entire semester. There are no homework grades so it's only based on exams and quizzes. Many people were dropping the class throughout, and if you aren't good at memorizing equations, good luck because you need to know about 20 for each exam.
There's a good curve, he will cold call in class it is scary, the 3 exams mean everything, so do the practice problems and never get behind.

The only way to succeed is to live and breathe the practice problems before each exam! Luckily there are plenty of resources available for you to study: the video problems, the homework problems, the lecture problems, the recitation problems, the homework quizzes, and the practice exams. And be sure to make good use of the tutor room for help.

In lectures he cold calls so I skipped almost every lecture (they dont take attendance in lecture) and just went to the recitation. Everything you need is in online lecture videos and recitation papers. Theres a curve at the end of the class. You just need to memorize everything no formulas are given. Recommend taking it earlier rather than later.
This class is not bad if you watch all the lecture videos before the recitations.
I thought he was a great teacher and explained the material well. I would say it was one of my more difficult classes and I did put a lot of work into it.

Marc Smith does a great job at explaining the material. Watch the lectures online before the two recitation classes for the week so you understand what's going on. Work with others on the quizzes and do the practice exam before exams. Another exam tip is to redo all the examples from your in-person questions.
Best Lecturer at OSU

I struggled a lot with Marc Smiths Accounting 1 class. Your grade is 80% exams and you only have three of them. Homework is optional, but you MUST do them if you want to succeed. I really wish this class met more than two times a week.

Before I took this class, I've heard so many horror stories about how hard it is. But after taking this class, Marc is an excellent professor and makes many accounting concepts easy to understand. Although accounting itself is very tedious, if you put in effort to study for the exams you will get a good grade.

This is a class that requires you to understand the concepts and math behind accounting. If you study the topic before and after the lectures, you should do fine. Marc is very passionate about this topic and it makes the class engaging. His lecture videos are very clear and are in an order that you should understand it. Great professor!

He is very difficult. No graded homework so your final grade is made up of 5 quizzes and 3 exams. I am a terrible test taker and studied for days and still did not do well. He is also the only professor that OSU has to teach the minor course. I know multiple people who dropped their business minor specifically because of him.

Many people have a bone to pick with Marc Smith. I find him to be passionate about teaching accounting and teaches the material in a simplified, easy to understand manner. He is very accessible after class/via email, or you can just go into the tutor room with questions. Many people are not willing to put in the effort for this class.

This class is completely online minus a weekly in-person recitation. It was not easy, 5-10 people were dropping this class per week. The exams do not give partial credit and are difficult, the quizzes were fine. OSU needs to stop paying this guy six figures for providing his online modules from 4 years ago, teach in person, or don't teach.

Marc Smith is not a bad teacher, Accounting can just be very tedious. Treat his accounting classes like a regular math course and you will be fine. Attend classes, watch videos, practice with the homework and do well on the quizzes.

This was one of my least favorite classes in Fisher, but Marc is a great professor. To get a good grade, you need to study the material regularly and cannot fall behind by any means. The material is difficult in my opinion, but you always know what to expect when exams come around because of the ample study resources that are provided.

Marc is an ok professor and he does his best to make lectures interesting, but everything is very impersonal which makes it hard to be motivated to try. The set up is a flipped classroom, which I really don't like, and it sucks that he essentially has a monopoly on accounting at Fisher so you have no option but to take him. Overall he's fine
He is a awesome professor. I loved going to his lectures and he make bland topics interesting. I don't know why he gets such a bad rep but he's by far one of the best professors at Fisher.

Marc Smith is a good teacher. I think his course gets a bad rap because accounting can be very confusing and quite honestly is not that interesting. Go to class, watch the videos, and do the optional homework and you will be fine.

Marc is genuinely one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State, despite his bad rep among students. His class is VERY organized and he has very clear expectations. It should not be hard to get a good grade on the exams if you simply attend lectures and recitations and do all of the homework and lecture videos. His exams are very fair.
Be prepared to participate! Great lecturer, will learn a lot if you pay attention.
You will succeed in this class if you keep up with lecture notes and do the optional homework. If you do these things, there are no surprises on the tests.

Marc Smith is a great teacher with lots of teaching effort and pretty much tell you every concept that you need. The key to success is to watch the pre-lecture videos and work hard for few days before the exam.

Marc smith is a great teacher. Accounting is hard and he really simplifies it as much as possible to make people succeed. It is all on you to do the studying for exams but if you do actually study hard you will do well. Recitation attendance is mandatory. Pretty much no homework. Just study hard the 3 or 4 days before exam and you will do good.

Marc is extremely fair. He will teach you everything you need to know. Get ready to put in a good amount of effort for exam because the exam will challenge you. Marc is a good guy that wants everyone to do well, but the content is challenging so students that don't put in enough effort will struggle.

Marc is an amazing professor. The course material itself is very hard, but if you follow along with the lecture videos and take notes accordingly, you will have an easier time in the class. He adds an extra 10 points to the exams and curves the class. He truly tries to make his students as successful as possible.
Marc Smith is a good teacher, but I wish there were more resources offered to make students more successful. The tests ARE NOT curved when the averages are around a D or C-

Marc is definitely knowledgable and you can get a good grade if you work hard. Make sure to get a good group for the weekly quizzes. The test are somewhat difficult but if you grind for 2-3 days before you can get a decent grade. Class is curved. Marc isn't the most caring guy, he just presents you the content. Really not that much work beside test

The exams are too confusing for accounting 1 when we are just getting used to the material. I also do not like how he calls on people in a lecture that you do not have to go to. I want to go to learn, not feel intimidated if I do not know the material.

Accounting 1 and 2 are tough classes but Marc gives you everything you need to be able to do well. As long as you put in the work to do all of the practice problems (not just before the exam but while your learning) you can easily do well in the class. Marc is willing to help you whenever you need it and he is very clear in lecture.

I wish I had more Professors who teach like Marc Smith. His lectures are amazing and to the point. very well-organized, and informative. He doesn't bloat you with unnecessary fillers. Just incredible.

at the same time, his exams reflect his efforts in lectures. They're going to be difficult and tricky, but he'll be fair.

A lot of people say he is difficult but if you do everything he tells you to (even the non mandatory stuff) you will not have any issues. Exams are exactly like the homework and offer extra credit. The class is super well organized. He gives you literally everything you need to succeed, you just have to use it. Hard class but extremely passable :)
just awful.

Marc is very passionate about what he teaches and it is very easy to tell that.  He gives you everything you need to succeed you just need to take what he gives you and study a lot.  Best professor I have had at fisher and you will do fine if you just put some effort in.

I hated accounting, but I would be a fool to lie and say Marc is not an amazing professor. He knows his accounting and he gives you everything you need to succeed. His lectures convey the material magnificently. Let me be clear: you MUST do the homework and practice problems to pass. I never went to recitation, but I thoroughly recommend it.

Course is well organized. But, extremely hard. Must put in the work - you'll probably still do awful, but somehow make it out alive with the curve. Marc is very rude when you reach out to him with a personal concern - especially to students who take exams at the SLDS.

Some hate on him because they don't like accounting, but there's a reason why he's one of the most respected professors in the entire field. As long as you stay on top of the modules, do quizzes with other people to check answers, and work with the practice problems to study, you should be fine. The once a week lecture is very engaging and useful.
Best professor at Fisher tbh. He knows how to teach and is passionate about his Accounting courses. They are just extremely hard.

During the summer of 2022, I was looking at these same reviews of Marc Smith, many describing it as a nightmare class. After taking the class in its entirety, I can assure you that it is not. I found Marc to be a very detailed, and thorough professor. He wants you to do well, and the material he provides is a huge help.

I thought accounting 2 was harder than 1, but once you realize how to study for the exams it isn't too bad. Nonetheless, it's still a very difficult class. I did like how organized Marc was and how he gave you everything you need to know, you just have to learn how to apply it. Thank goodness I'm done with the accounting classes.

Marc is one of the best professors at Fisher and organizes the class in a way that if you dedicate enough time each week (and ample time leading up to the exams), you will get an A. Take notes over the lecture videos, do the homework, participate in lecture & recitation, & redo old problems to study, and you will get a high A guaranteed!!!

Marc gives you everything needed to thrive in this class. You just have to put the work in outside of the classroom. Take the practice exams multiple times. Also watch the modules before Monday's class so you're not behind and lost. Not unfair at all, but heavy commitment is required to excel. Literally the definition of a weed-out class.

Marc Smith is a man who is passionate about what he teaches. As long as you watch the pre-lecture videos, attend all the lectures, and attend the required labs, this should be an easy A. To study, I liked to rewatch his lecture videos at about 1.5-1.75x speed.

I thought this class was hard considering also that it was only graded on 3 tests and 5 quizzes. I got all 100's on the quizzes.I studied so much for the last test and did so bad. I thought it was impossible. Thank god the curve brought my grade a full letter grade.
Not enough points and is all test based. He expects you to be the best test taker and gives no additional points.

Professor Smith was the most difficult and least understanding professor I had during my time at OSU. Attendance is absolutely mandatory, and there are no excused absences for any reason including death of a family member, or having COVID. And the exams are most of the class grade, and you will not be prepared though any provided materials.
Marc "Daddy" Smith is still one of my favorite lecturers, still, kinda wish he added some extra points to offset the big tests. Just remember to do the sample exam before doing the exams

Marc is a good professor and I could have probably done much better in this class if I would have given more effort. Don't believe anyone who says its unpassable they're just lazy like me. The only thing I have to say is that Marc does not keep up with the times. He expects you to know accounting like its 1970 and there's no such thing as internet.
quizzes and exams are your only grades. exams are extremely challenging closed note. there is no partial or extra credit but there is a curve.

Marc is a great professor and is extremely knowledgable. He presents the material in a very clear and straight forward manner. This class is easy to mess up because your grade is purely based on 3 exams and 6 quizzes. Definitely attend lecture. For exams I made quizlets with all the important terms and formulas which I highly suggest.

Marc is a good teacher but this class is loaded with hard content. I am about to get an A in the class and honestly its because I participate regularly and I studied like crazy for the exams. Do not do the homework for the class it is a waste of energy. If anything REWATCH THE LECTURE VIDEOS over and over Do the practice tests and redo the quizzes.

Marc is a great professor and is very caring/ enthusiastic. He has a-lot of responsibility within the business school, but tutoring sessions are very accessible and helpful. His class is difficult, but more because the content is hard. To do well in this class, you must keep up with the content provided and watch his weekly lecture videos .

Marc is truly a legend, and one of the best professors in the business department at OSU. His lectures are well put together and easy to follow. He gives a ton of practice problems which helps those that can only learn from practice. The only negative is the three exams are worth 80% of your grade, so it is very important to do well on the exams.
Worst class Ive ever taken. Severely damaged my mental health and made me the most stressed Ive ever felt. Ive always done good in school and this class really hurt my confidence.
Good at teaching but horrid at writing exams.

This class can be considered difficult by some, but I found if you watch the weekly lecture videos and attend your recitation, and take the provided practice exam before each exam an A in this class is very achievable.
Hi everyone, welcome back. Betty Derose, ABC, XYZ company

People will tell you horror stories about this class but honestly, if you do the work he requires on an efficient timeline, it is not bad at all. Marc is a great lecturer and is very clear and organized in providing class criteria and due dates well ahead of time. I never had any trouble in either accounting class, it is all about time management.
I've heard horror stories about this class and don't get me wrong, it's not a cakewalk. However, if you put in the time, watch every lecture, and do the practice problems, it is definitely doable.

Marc is a great professor! He does a fantastic job at explaining tough concepts! The class is well organized and if you watch the online modules, go to lecture & recitation, and practice with the homework- you'll be fine! I found that his exams were really easy if I just made a Quizlet with the vocab terms & redid old practice problems to study.

He is a very good professor, much better than some of the bad professors at osu. People say that the intro to accounting 2200 class is incredibly hard, it is not. If you just take an hour out of your day and put his lectures on 2x speed you can then go to his "review class/lecture" with at least some knowledge.

Very difficult for an intro class. He teaches both required accounting classes for all business students, so if you want a business degree there's no other option. Does explain everything, but is very boring and his teaching style is very difficult. Watch lectures on your own time, and only go to class to work on practice problems

Of what I’ve taken so far at Fisher, Professor Smith’s courses are the most organized by far. However, 90% of the weight is on 3 exams, all of which are extremely difficult. Do the non-mandatory homework, do the lecture problems, and then gauge your skills with the practice exam. It’s awful but you will become stronger as a student.

As an introduction to accounting, this class is very difficult. Marc Smith is extremely boring to listen to. He is very serious the whole time in lecture and takes his accounting extremely seriously, even for an intro level class. I believe his content is too strong for new comers and scares them away from accounting.
He is very hard, study hard
Good professor if you do the work

Marc is a great professor, however, the exams are a bit difficult. Do your best to do the homework's, they aren't for a grade but you will be better for doing them. It is a weed-out class, so just don't get weeded out.

I do not care what anyone says. this guy is the best teacher at OSU. His class is difficult but if you do everything he gives you then you will get a good grade. Most I have ever learned in one class.
Marc smith does not care so you better if you want to pass.

Marc is a great professor. His class is well organized, and he is very easy to communicate with. However, the course is graded by very few quizzes and tests, so I found it difficult to do well. No matter how hard I worked in the class, I could not comprehend accounting. Thankfully, he showed grace and curved our final grades.

The class itself is very difficult and time consuming, marc does an amazing job of explaining and getting students to think. He offers practice exams that were very similar to the exam but the 3 exams are worth a lot of your grade almost 80%. If you pay attention, DO THE HOMEWORK, and double check your quiz work with classmates you will be fine.

Marc Smith maintains the gold standard of teaching accounting basics. Sets clear expectations for exams and quizzes. TA's are very helpful and recommended if you are struggling with the more math intensive parts of the class. There are in-person exams at night that are mostly multiple choice.

Look, I'll give it you straight. Accounting is not a breeze. But if you put in the work, you'll be fine. Marc Smith explains and walks through things THE BEST out of any professors I've had. Pay close attention to the online lectures, and do the lecture problems WITH him. If you can do the HW problems on your own, you will get an A on the exam.

Marc Smith is by far the best professor I have had at Ohio State. Although his class consists of a lot of work, it is not as much as some other business core classes require. He takes a lot of time to go over very clear explanations about how to do problems. He gives you everything you need to succeed and I like his class structure a lot!

Marc is the most organized professor Ive had at Ohio State. The class is difficult but all the materials are given to you and if you do all of the ungraded homeworks there arent any surprises. He gives hints about exams which I wish I paid more attention to earlier. Exams are very difficult but if you study like he tells you to youll do fine

Marc is one of the best professors in Fisher. Accounting 1 and 2 aren't supposed to be easy but his structured material and good explanations help a lot in succeeding in the class. Do ALL the work and practice problems that he gives and it will help so much on the exams.
Watching lecture videos and recitation recordings helped a lot more than doing homework/practice problems. Good professor, just a very difficult class as it's a weed out class in Fisher.

I know many dont like Marc, but hes not asking for much. Do everything he provides and you will pass this class. He may expect a lot out of people to be prepared for class, but thats not too much to ask. Everyone wants to take the easy route and try to give half effort, and that just wont work. Easily the most organized class and professor ever

There are very few grades and the exams are worth almost the whole grade. The questions on exams are worth a lot of points each with no partial credit. You really have to pay attention and study and do the optional homeworks to know whats going on. And dont forget your calculator for exams.

Take a step into a time machine before quickbooks existed and you would need to manually resolve the most intricate accounting issues without any formula assistance. The level of difficulty is completely disproportionate to the fact that nobody will ever need to know this material in the real world.
Class is impossible, but Marc Smith cares about students and cares about teaching
Marc is really good at teaching accounting. He is the best accounting teacher I have ever met. Hope my acctmis2300 marc can be much better.

One of the worst courses I've had to take. Exams are worth about 75% of your final grade, and they're structured in a way such that missing just a few questions will absolutely destroy your grade. Makes you memorize insane formulas (some questions require the use of 9+ unique ones you need to have memorized). No partial credit.
No partial credit on quizzes or exams. (Some questions are up to 9 points each) Homework not graded Only 10 grades total: 1 syllabus quiz, 6 quizzes and 3 exams

The lectures and practice don't give a clear picture of what you need to know. You pay attention in lecture and everything seems to make sense, then when you get to the quiz or test you feel like you didn't learn what you needed to learn in order to pass.

Marc is nothing short of a hardass. He never makes grading exceptions, his exams are incredibly difficult, and in many ways is a rite of passage for business students. However, he has by far the best designed online course I have ever taken and he does a fantastic job of explaining the material.

In my 4 years at Ohio State I dont believe I have faced a more difficult class. Ive aced every other course ive taken in Fisher, literally every other course. Marc really isnt a bad guy, but he IS a bad professor. If you want to spend the semester crying over a class, sure take it, if not do yourself a favor and take accounting at C-State.
One of the best professors here in Fisher

Marc Smith is a great professor. He teaches the material well. If your like me and do not pick up material super easily, you will need to do lots of practice problems each week to stay on schedule. There were 4 exams and 4 quizes making up your grade. Exams were very diffucult. 10 questions worth 50-65 points each. Study a lot.

Marc Smith does not care about your grade. You will learn greatly from his lectures, however, they do not cover NEARLY enough detail needed. If this was the only class you had to take for the semester? You're in luck then, because he expects you to spend 30 hours a week on his material. Felt he was not looking out for the student either.
Professor Smith is great at explaining the material. You have to do all the practice problems in order to succeed in this class. Repetition is key! However, his final exam was very hard!

His videos were very helpful and he made it easy to understand the concepts. However, a lot of the material was difficult to understand. I thought the final in this class was very difficult, but I think if you spend a lot of time in this class you can succeed.

If you are willing to work, you will do well in this class. I got a D on the first test with preparation of watching all of the lecture videos, Tuesday recitations, and completing the study guide. Wanting to do better, I decided to do every problem in the module prior to the test and now have an A in the class. If you want to do well just work hard

Very harsh when grading exams. Also makes you take exams on Fridays at 6:30pm. What professor does this?? Worst possible time to take an exam. This was the toughest college course Ive ever taken, do not recommend.

I've heard some crazy things about Marc, but from what I have seen, he is a good guy. He always helped me whenever I needed it. Got the material across clearly. He is a very organized guy. You have to study in order to pass this class! There is no faking this stuff. It is easy math but you gotta know which numbers to use.

Marc Smith was truly a solid professor, but with that being said avoid at all costs. His exams are absolutely brutal for absolutely no reason. What his lectures and homework problems show are nothing nearly as challenging as the exam. So overall, you will truly learn a lot, but your final grade will not show it at all.

This class is tough and mistakes will take a large toll on your final grade. In order to do good in his class, you must do all the lecture, recitation, and homework problems to learn from the little tricks that Marc might throw on you in the exams. Learn from your mistakes before taking the exam. This class is well organized. Good luck!
Expects you to not have a life. Videos are long and so old. If you don't have a life then getting a decent grade will be easy.
If you give his classes a good effort then it is not difficult to get an A. He is a great professor who is very passionate about accounting and explains it as clearly as he possibly could.

Marc is probably the best teacher Ive ever had. He gives you all of the material and practice problems you need to prepare you for exams and never tries to purposefully trick you. If you watch and take notes on his pre-recorded lectures videos, you can get an easy A. Do the practice problems to study and you'll see everything you need to pass exams
Very hard class and not a great professor. Tests he gives are very difficult.

Grades aside, If you have the option to be in-person, do it. His videos for lectures are old and easy to get distracted from. They changed how they did quizzes this semester, and for the better. The exams on the other hand are still extremely hard and time consuming. I used up the entire time on every exam.

Marc Smith is a great professor. He actually teaches the material very well and goes very in-depth. However, you need to put the time in to watch his modules and attend his lectures. If you do this, take good notes, and study for the exams, you will do pretty well. I know he has few grades, but he also curves the course at the end usually.

Marc Smith is challenging. But he does give you a lot of information to use. The recitations are a lifesaver as well as the extra homework. Make sure you know all of the topics. There are only 8 things that get graded throughout the entire semester. Study a lot before the tests and make an equation sheet. This was a literal lifesaver.

The class is difficult and requires a lot of work but it is a class that makes OSU distinguished from other universities. No other intro accounting class is this in-depth and tough, but if you put the work in to learn what Marc puts into his award-winning online lectures, you'll feel a lot more accomplished leaving the class than you did coming in.

I took online class with him and here are some honest feedbacks. He only had quizzes and tests. Definitely go to recitations or go through the recordings if you take it online. His problems were exactly the same as he talked about in the recitations. Go throgh all of them, and you'll be fine.

Does not give enough chances for students to improve. Videos are reused every year for like 5+ years. Does not give realistic practice exam questions for students or worksheets. Not enough time to take exam.

Marc Smith is a good guy and a good professor, but only having 7 grades for the whole semester leaves absolutely 0 room for students to have any error if they're trying to get an A. Exams tend to be a little tougher than the quizzes and lectures. Mess up one big exam and you're sort of screwed for the rest of the semester.

BEWARE!!! The exams are excessively hard for no reason and the class averages are always below a 70%. Of course there are outliers that will get As but the majority of the class will do poorly. Overall terrible professor and just your typical weed out class.

Class is structured in a organized manner with modules covering each week. If the material doesn't click with you there are office hours and TA work sessions where you can easily learn to understand the material. In addition, you'll receive emails a week before the exam if you get sidetracked and haven't went through lectures for the previous week.
The most organized class I've ever taken. Marc takes a dump on the organization of all these other online classes. No partial credit is a b word, but show up and do the work and you will be fine.
Professor Smith is excellent. He is very clear about what is going to be on exams. The class itself is boring, but he makes it easy. If you take decent notes in lecture youll pass.
Class is organized. But you cannot watch lectures at 1.5x. Overall an easy class.
god awful terrible. Purposely makes the problems hard

I just took ACCTMIS 2200 with Marc Smith and he is not what people say he is. His class is well organized and I believe he truly understands how to explain accounting to people who don't understand. His quizzes/exams are purely based on his lectures and practice problems, which makes it easy to study for. Go to class and master the content for an A

Marc is a good professor in my opinion. He explains things very well and gives you everything you need to succeed in the class. Since it's online there is no partial credit so if you make a small mistake you miss the whole problem. Exams are only 10 questions so you're already at a B if you miss one problem. Good thing is everything is open note.

No partial credit on assignments and exams makes for a painful experience if you make small mistakes here and there. I would describe myself as a good student and the topics in this course are not particularly hard, which makes my grade result even more frustrating. Its unfortunate that this guy is the only professor available for accounting.

It's accounting with Marc Smith, yes it's a tough class. That said, if you prioritize it (which you should), a good grade is possible. What I did: watched the module videos Thursday and Friday, enjoy the weekend, do the practice problems Monday, attend recitation Tuesday, do the problem assignment Wednesday. Stay organized. Be confident. You got it

Not a bad professor, just a challenging class. Was much easier during COVID semesters because exams were open note. Marc isn't super helpful outside of class, but tells you almost exactly what you need to do to succeed in his class. Lot of work required to do well but not impossible.

I really enjoyed this class. He is very knowledgeable and I learned so much in this class. If you want to do well you have to do all the assignments, quizzes, and problem assignments. Go to office hours, go to the accounting tutor room. The resources are there for you to do well. Also attend recitation.

Accounting is difficult but Marc does not try to trick you on quizzes or exams. They're all open note and his lectures and recitation problems prepare you well. All lectures can be done on your own time which is really convenient!!

A lot of people really dont like him cuz his tests are hard and hes very particular but he genuinely gives you everything you need to succeed. Yes the class is hard and you have to study a lot but his class is so organized and if you really pay attention and take good notes you can get a good grade. Gonna miss him
Uncaring career academic with little real world experience. Enjoys watching students struggle to meet his criteria.

Marc Smith is undeniably the worst professor at The Ohio State University. Not accommodating whatsoever even during a global pandemic he simply has no care for his students. Class is organized, but I would stay away from him on all costs. Take any accounting classes at any other university other than at The Ohio State University with him.

this professor is one of the worst at osu. going back i'd take this course somewhere else. do yourself a favor, dont study your just wasting your time, no matter how much you put in you wont get anything out. class is so hard instructor had to add a curve at the end.
test are near impossible professor is very bad and unkind. These reviews are not all written y students beware
Good guy and easy to understand. Sets clear expectations and provides resources for you to be successful. However you do have to study and do the work for an A.

Marc loves to throw curveballs good luck studying for these exams because it is impossible. Marc says that the class takes work, and that is true except if you do a reasonable amount of work you will probably still fail. This professor is not willing to work with you on most issues, he is quite rude. I would recommend avoiding at all costs.

I think he gets a bad rep amongst those who do poorly because they don't understand the amount of effort it takes to get a good grade for a class like accounting. Yeah, it's more difficult than your average business class, but it's not hard enough to point to be labeled unfair. Put in the effort and you'll succeed.

This professor prides himself on making this course exceptionally difficult. If you struggle with complicated algebra (i.e simultaneous equations & substitution) I recommend taking this course at another university. Each question is word problem format and has 3 to 5 fluctuating variables. Professor is not flexible whatsoever. Tests hard (60 avg)

I took Acct4500 virtual during Summer. The class was not a breeze. I was not able to attend the Live session, so watched the recorded version of it & took heavy notes. 3 Quizzes,3Exams. M/C and Short essay questions. I did better on short essay questions. Class is CPA level difficult, something Marc is known for. But the effort pays off.

Teaching wasn't bad. Very clearn when you ask questions. Exams were so difficult though. You better have a CPA book to keep up, and expect the exam multiple choice questions to be harder than the CPA itself. I only recommend if you're willing to put in a ton of extra effort just to pass.

Marc runs a tight ship, but he is very knowledgeable and respected. Always come to lecture prepared since he cold-calls often. Do the practice exams and practice problems at least twice to prepare for the exams. The class felt a bit 'old school' with the outdated lecture videos and test-taking protocol, but I learned a lot. Welcome back! Lol.

Marc is the best professor I ever had. Im an international student and Im still learning English, but it is so easy to understand his classes because he always uses the most simple words. Every time he explains the problems he makes them seem really easy to solve. Patience, dedication and his passion for teaching are his strongest points.

2200 and 2300 with Marc are hard but fair. A good grade in this class is certainly possible but the time commitment is heavy, be sure to remember that during scheduling. Be sure to study all the material provided because it probably will all be fair game on the exam.

I wish every class was ran the way that Marc runs Accounting 1 and 2. Watch the lecture videos, go to lecture, and rework the homework problems a couple times each without your notes and you'll be fine if you're a competent student

Marc's classes are highly organized. You can always know what you should do to boost your grades. He gives lots of exercises like homework and practice exams. If you really work on these stuffs, you'll find it easy to deal with exam. The thing is if you make a mistake on a problem, your point will be largely taken off. Be careful on calculations.

Marc is one of the best profs out there. He's fair, incredibly organized, and is very clear what he expects from his students. You definitely have to work for the grade! He is an amazing lecturer and he has my respect. Marc has high expectations, but that does not make him a bad prof. He's challenging in the best way possible. We need more like him

Challenging class but he gives you all the materials to do well as long as you watch the online lecture videos and show up to lecture and problem session class. Best way to study for exams is to do the optional homework and practice exam. Very passionate about the material and good professor.

Hyperactive prof that knows his stuff. Best way to do well on the exams: write out lecture notes, do practice exams, and do practice and recitation problems because recitation problems are really helpful when he wants to add a twist to even the simplest questions.
Mean >:(

Marc Smith is one of the most well-known professors in Fisher. His classes are very challenging but he gives all the materials you need to succeed. Rewatch all the modules right before the exam, write down importance formulas, and go over the problems he gives in class. I honestly loved the class.
