Inaccessible outside of class; Given I had it at 8am, lectures are incredibly boring to sit through, reads off slides verbatim with very little additional information/key details to remember; A couple group projects that are extensive for little point values; Would never recommend anyone to take his class; Normal A student, not a great experience.

The absolute worst professor. Randomly calls on students and makes them answer questions, grading is terrible. So incredibly picky when it comes to grading, you never know what he is expecting. Also a good amount of team presentations and if your group sucks your screwed. Coming from a normal A student, good luck trying to get an A in this class.

Prof. Sheneman's energy in class was great and she definitely knows her stuff. Lectures were well-paced and there were a few in-class team assignments that were good for solidifying knowledge. Rote memorization won't really help you learn the material; you have to understand how the topics actually work in order to do well on her exams.
The exams were extremely challenging, and the results didn't seem to reflect the effort I put in.
The exam content was not related to the sample questions and the exam was very difficult. CRAZY！！！

Professor Sheneman is one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. Far and away one of the best at lecturing/teaching you material I have ever seen. That being said, her exams are hard and she is a strict grader on her papers.

Really good professor. Lectures are interesting because she's hilarious. She genuinely wants to help students. But participation is 15% of your grade, and she is not very lenient on grading that. If you're one who doesn't like to participate, you won't do well in this class. Exams are tough but fair, and there's NO curve.

Love Sheneman. Definitely the most entertaining professor at Fisher. If you get a chance to choose her for Audit you should. Wish I could have taken more than just the one class with her. Audit is hard, but she makes it decent through lectures and helpful exam study guides.

Don't take him for Cost Accounting. He is very nice, but his teaching style is tough and the class moves fast. You'll need to learn a lot outside of class, and the pace makes it hard to keep up. As a straight-A student, I struggled a lot, so if you're looking for an easier experience and a better shot at a good grade, choose another professor
I learned a great deal, would take him again!

Corona is mediocre at best. His lecture is dry and his teaching style is to ramble about the topic which is hard to follow. He assigns projects and doesn't even mention them to us and expects us to understand them along with other major assignments. Do not take unless you want to challenge yourself beyond belief.
Hard class but you learn so much. She's amazing best teacher I've had so far at OSU.

Prof. Sletten is truly amazing- although this class is NOT for the weak. You need to study, put in the work, and pay attention. Her lectures and explanations are great you can tell she cares about her students. Go to office hours, get to know your TAs and expect this to be one of your hardest classes. But don't get discouraged, there's a curve :)

Professor Sletten is a great instructor. Despite the challenging nature of the course, her ability to explain complex material is exceptional. She breaks down concepts with clarity, providing examples that make the content accessible and engaging. She does drop 2 out of 5 quizzes.

content isn't for the faint of heart its a tough class but she definitely sets you up for success her lectures are pretty clear and concise and is willing to take the time to work with concepts you don't understand but be warned its definitely test heavy as they are worth a significant portion of your grade

Take Katie. When talking to other students who had Marc, I felt so lucky. The class is going to be somewhat difficult but Katie is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Definitely agree that the homework was harder than what we learned but they are manageable. Tests are slightly harder than practice exams but not much. Didn't use the textbook once.

Accounting 1 is going to be a struggle for most students. If you are debating between her and Marc here are some things I liked about her class vs Marc's accounting 2. She does her lectures in person, no extra videos you have to watch. Her classes are a lot smaller so you can get a more personalized feel

Katie's class at first was difficult, but after the first exam you'll get the hang of it. Her class is so much better than Marc's class. She takes class time to explain topics throughly. and her exams are also so much easier because they are graded on your work as well as the correct answer. If you are debating between Katie and Marc, choose Katie!

I had Professor Lem for Accounting 1 in Fall of 2023. The material was hard to comprehend and you were often left with little to no guidance on what/how to study for the exams. Her exams are impossible as multiple choice was worth a lot of points. She would always throw something on there we never did in class making it hard to do well. Take Marc!

I can't lie. I did not enjoy having Katie. I am not sure if it was the material in general, but I just felt like the teaching wasn't great. Her slides are all right but often the homework was nothing like what you learned. The exams are rather long and multiple choice is worth far too many points. She is also a little intimidating, sadly.

This professor was excellent, providing clear and comprehensive class PPTs, and the review PPTs were also helpful. Despite the handwritten exams, effective review ensures high scores. The professor is approachable and offers valuable advice for problem-solving.
Strict but caring professor.  Grades for exams were fair.

He is one of the most engaging and organized professors I ever had at the mba program at OSU (course I took is mba6211) His lectures are clear, easy to follow, never boring, and very helpful at simplifying difficult concepts. I did not imagine I could sit in an online class for 3.5 hr straight but I did and time passed fast! highly recommend.

He's a nice guy, but not a fan of the way he taught. There's a disconnect between the lectures and textbook when it comes to both concepts and ways to solve the problems. Lecture slides aren't posted until after class, which is unhelpful for note-taking/working on in-class problems. If I could go back, I'd study the textbook more than the lectures.

His accounting class is pretty tough, I didn't think he was a great professor, I struggled on the first exam (overall the class did as well) and then found Preston of 405 Tutoring, use a tutor otherwise this class is really hard unless you eat/sleep/breathe accounting
Super nice professor! Defiantly would recommend!
He makes learning fun and is very engaging with his students.

The content of this course was difficult, but professor Easterday always brought a lot of energy into the classroom and was passionate about teaching the material. He has a lot of audit experience to help make lectures easier to get through. The exams were fairly difficult, but you can get at least a C on them if you attend lectures.

Professor Easterday is awesome. Accounting is difficult but he prepared a lot for this class. He also recorded the audio for the textbook so that we can listen to it. Professor Easterday provides many make-up points opportunities like in-class assignments; pre-class assignments. I enjoy attending Professor Easterday's Accounting class.
Start the prework ahead of time and really focus as its on the quizzes. Test questions come from book bank so do the study prep things. Not an easy class but teacher cares and curves accordingly

One of only professors at Fisher who actually cares about his students and yet still pushes us to be the best. Rest of Fisher staff not so much. He clearly is for the student and he had soo many good life lessons besides teaching this class. Lots of material. Do homework/keep up and you will be fine. Refreshing to see someone engage with students.

This class has a solid amount of material, but as long as you read the textbook and pay attention in the lecture. The tests are very similar in question style to the OneNote exercises that you do in class. There is a very fair 85% median curve for the 4 exams that make up the class. Some of the Pearson homework can be a bit tedious but not crazy.

Homeworks don't align with exam well, and he doesn't provide a practice exam/many helpful resources to prepare. Exam time is not enough. He moves very fast in lecture. His handwriting is very difficult to read when looking over problems we worked on in class.

AWFUL. not enough time for exam. grade is almost only from exams. He says to do mental reps of all the questions (how do you even do that? you wouldn't know if you're doing it right). Also gives horrible feedback and provides no resources for test prep. The hw, recitation, lecture problems he says he gives bc they might not be on the exam...

He literally says that he asks questions in the hw bc it WONT be on the exam or maybe it will. He doesn't give any resources to help people study/prep for exams. He is accessible but his exams are very long 28 questions in 1 hr and many of the problems are lengthy word problems. He says to do "mental reps" of all the problems in the book ...

The semester isn't even over yet and I already feel the need to recommend her to any accounting student. Prof. Glenn is such a lovely professor, she outlines exactly what will be on her exams and brings in guest speakers to give us a glimpse of various companies. She provides extra credit opportunities and always livens the mood. 10/10 professor!

Great professor and an amazing person. Explains material clearly and brings in guest speakers so we could learn more about the professional work side of accounting. Really cares about the students and exams were very similar to in-class problems. Talks about the CPA and prepares us for it as well which is very helpful. Highly recommend!

HIGHLY recommend Professor Glenn for Tax 2! She's very clear as to what goes in the exams and offers multiple extra credits. Breaks down each chapters into something easier to understand. Take her and you won't regret it. Extremely understandable if you can't make it to class, as long as you communicate to her. She's also very funny!

One of the best professors I had at Ohio State. Professor Glenn was amazing. She was funny and always had jokes when some of the tax conversations got dry. Exams were very fair and based on problems we did for homework and in class. Went out of her way to help prepare us for the CPA exams and expose us to what we will do after graduation.
JG! She's the goat. Very clear about what she's grading on and super willing to help students all the time.

Tax 2 is definitely a difficult class. Professor Glenn was a great professor and made the class more manageable, even in an online environment. She made it super clear what would and wouldn't be on the exams, and her review sessions were incredibly helpful for preparing for exams. I would totally recommend her for Tax 2!

I think this was her first or second year of teaching but she was an awesome professor. She was very clear about which topics she would be testing on during lectures and held a review session outside of class before every exam. Shes a little nerdy but shes so cute and really wants everyone to succeed. I highly recommend taking her class.

Professor Monsen is my favorite professor I have has so far at Fisher. His content is challenging, but he gives you the materials to succeed and lightens the somewhat dry material with jokes. I would take any class taught by him in the future.

Professor Monsen is easily the best professor I have had in Accounting at OSU. Explains things very clearly and breaks down concepts in a way students can understand. Yes, the class is test heavy (70%) but the exams are very fair. If you show up to class and take good notes you will get an A. Make sure you take Monsen if you want to do well in 3201
His class is challenging, but given that we are accounting major students, I think it is fair. His PowerPoint is easy to follow. Love this class.

This man clearly loves teaching accounting. He tries to make lectures engaging and if you have questions he is more than happy to meet with you during office hours. The written response part of the exams can be brutal sometimes however, he applies a large curve around 10%. I learned so much and I thought he taught pretty well.
Very kind and caring, and easily approachable outside of class. He uses a lot of dry humor which I really enjoyed that kept class interesting. He really cares about student success.

He communicates clearly and does it in a way that is engaging and entertaining. Although he made the class test heavy, he gives you all the tools you need to succeed. Learners should take his course, slackers beware.

Hands down best instructor I've had in Fisher. Keeps material relevant to real life, makes an effort to know his students, has an ability to explain things clearly, writes fair exams, and keeps class interesting and funny. Loved this class.

Hands down the best professor I've had here at Ohio State. Was really good at communicating difficult subject matter and setting up the course in a way that encouraged students to actually learn the material rather than memorizing it for tests.

Even though the material was difficult, Professor Monsen truly made the class effective and organized. I was impressed with his knowledge of the material, ability to answer any questions that were asked, the organizational structure of the class, and the fair exams. They were very difficult, but he gave all the tools to succeed if you worked hard.

The whole class struggled except some who the concepts came naturally to. Power points were not conducive to learning. Tests are heavily weighted so if you aren't a good test taker I'd recommend someone else. Class avg. on some exams was 65%. Lack of real world experience (3 yrs in practice).
Makes the class harder than it needs to be. Unable to think about broader concepts of education.

Brian is definitely one of the best accounting profs in Fisher. He's entertaining, very knowledgable, and gives you all the tools to succeed in his class. Yes, tests are worth 75% of your grade, but his tests are more than fair and he gives a lot of partial credit. If you don't do well in his class, it's because you did not put in the work.

Very boring lectures, endless amount of material all presented in the most confusing fashion. Needs to figure out how to teach and stop reading his powerpoints. No slack given on tests (note sheet, open book, anything). Yes the material is dry but teaching should not be, inspire your pupils.

Nice enough guy just bad at teaching. Constant power points are very bland and the lack of differentiation between problems confused nearly everyone. Tests are worth 75% this is ridiculous. No class should be over 50% test. I wish he realized how confused everyone is. He tests based on "mastery" not on the material. This is a trap avoid if you can.
Good guy, poor teacher. Just talks about his powerpoint never actually solves anything. Needs more structure and less heavy tests. Tests are weighted 75%. Not very good at explaining the material.

Prof. Monsen is a great guy. He's like a cool nerd because he's super into accounting, but he definitely knows how to explain things to the college-level student. His tests can be a bit unpredictable because he pulls questions from the CPA exam, but he curves the class pretty well so it balances out. Extra credit on tests is from lectures.

Professor Monsen did all I could have asked for out of a 3201 professor and more. He always showed us real-life financial statements so we saw how the material could be applied. He was always willing to help and was realistic about how difficult or easy material would be. Can't say enough good things!

Professor Monsen is the best professors in fisher. I took his 4490 and ACCT3201. He is really professional and genius. The most important is that he is caring and patient for every student. I was sick and doing surgery this semester so I did not study much for the class, but his class is the best. Best Professor ever!

There aren't enough nice words to describe Dr. Monsen! Extremely organized and delivers difficult material very well. His sense of humor and passion for accounting always kept me engaged during his lectures. The most difficult class I have taken so far in my college career, but definitely doable. Highly recommend Brian.
Really recommend professor Monsen! Awesome professional and professor. Its a hard class but he makes it better
Best professor ever!

Best professor ever. 10/10 would take again. Brian is very organized and delivers course material in an engaging way. I was always excited to attend his lecture. Understand the Connect problems and you will be fine for the exams. Brian was also always genuine and caring about his students and flexible with office hours.

Best 8 a.m. class ever. Very energetic and engaging professor. Brian puts a lot of effort into his lectures and teaches difficult concepts in a concise manner. Recommend doing the practice problems on CONNECT. Exam questions are similar to his examples on the slides and he gives partial credit on the workout problems. Generous curve at the end.

Dr. Gee is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He cares a lot about his students and that they are able to learn from his class. I would recommend to take a class with him if you have the chance.

I had him for fraud examination. His lectures were all over the place but his exams weren't too bad. He is very caring and talks about events going on which makes the class more enjoyable. He doesn't focus much on the slides when the exams are based on the slides from the book. There were 4 exams, a bunch of little assignments, and a group project.

I'm sure he would probably be a great guy to work with because he's so caring, but truthfully he's a mediocre professor at best. His lectures are never focused, and he skips around on the slides too much, which makes class confusing. Makes this class much harder than his ACCTMIS 7500 class, so watch out for that.

Everyone in the class will get a minimum of a B+ but he'll make you work for anything more. He is a passionate teacher but his lectures are dry. If you put the work in you will probably do well but I didn't think it was worth the amount of time it would take to excel and accepted the B+.
Professor Izzo is the best instructor in OSU I've ever met. The lecture was very clear, and go to his office hours are very helpful. The exams are not hard, he curved at the end.
very easy professor. super nice, pretty sure he returned from retirement to teach this class. Wish I learned more though. Exams are extremely easy.

I took his class during the summer online. Tax 2 is honestly a really tough course. This class is harder than the CPA exam, so you need to really like tax. He wasn't the worst professor, but was also not my favorite. Homework was weighted heavily, which is great. I wouldn't take this class if it weren't online.
Awesome Professor. Very helpful and made tax 2 as easy as possible.
Great professor! Highly recommend if taking CPA as many topics he introduces are included in REG.

The grade consists of 4 case studies (drops lowest score) and two exams. You are allowed cheat sheets for both exams, but a lot of us found the exams to still be very challenging. Definitely look at the case studies before class and understand the questions. Lacko is more than willing to answer/clarify any questions.

This dude is a real one. He wants to help you, will push back homework due dates or give answers, and tell you what will be on exams. My fave prof this semester. Going to class is important, I started to slack on going at the end and it really impacted my grade because he explains the material better than the book. I'd recommend him!

Lacko is an extremely nice guy. He is the type of professor that wants to try to give everyone an A. His lectures are kind of boring but he does a good job of teaching the material and letting you know what will be on the exams. Also very willing to push back due dates for homeworks and give answers on them
I do not like tax, but Alan Lacko made it almost enjoyable. Great teacher and a great guy.
He is very  friendly and willing to help in any ways. He basically tell what's the right answers are during the case. Just to help you to learn the material for the test.
Tax is boring, but he explains things well when you ask. You should be able to teach yourself based off his powerpoints and examples
Very clear in content and really kind to students.
Participation counts 70% of the final grade

Schroeder is by far the worst professor I have ever had. The material in the class is impossible and he expects students to teach it to the class without him teaching anything to you. No one had a clue what was going on. My stress levels have never been so high in a class before. He tells you to read the textbook which makes zero sense. AVOID!!!

Although attendance is not mandatory in this class, I highly suggest you attend. This class was very hard and not many people had a clue of what was going on the entire time. But if you put in work, attend class, and try to follow along in class, then you will end with a descent grade. The final is actually pretty reasonable as well.
Tough class, but if you actually put in the work, you are able to learn a lot about concepts and theories. Easy pass if you show up to class, participate and turn in your homework.
I do not suggest taking his class, he is a person with discrimination . And he really don't care about students.

He doesn't care if you actually know the material; he just wants to show students how much smarter he is than them. Literally scoffs after every question he gets asked and then gives the answer in the most vague way possible. If you can take this class with a different teacher, do it.

He assigns groups and you present the chapters to the class. This allows you to learn the material better and helps with social skills. He is very helpful and helps when you get stuck, etc. and if you are wiling to participate you will get a B or higher.

If you want to learn the material, he isn't the prof for you. Really difficult, confusing, and his explanations won't help. However, if you're looking to up your GPA, go to class, participate and make sure he knows your name. You won't learn a thing, but you'll get an A if you show up and try.

Lectures are confusing and unhelpful. He refuses to answer questions during office hours. If you want to get an A, go to class and make sure he knows your name. Ask questions about the homework and seem interested. The only grade is the final and its really difficult, but he knows that. As long as he knows your name, you'll get an A.

He is not a doubt the worst prof I have ever had in my past 4 years here. Materials are impossible to understand, not related to real cost accounting whatsoever, does not take any question during office hour, also he is definitely not a lenient greader considering how horrible of a teacher he is. Avoid him like the plague.
Do the homework. Ask questions in class. Need to work hard to understand material, but if you ask him questions during class he will clarify things pretty well.
Literally the worst teacher in the history of the world. AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS!!!! HE IS THE WORST TEACHER EVER.

Give Prof. Schroeder a chance. Yes, the material is extremely difficult. However, if you attend class and make your best effort to comprehend what is communicated in class, you will receive a positive grade. Accept that much of the mechanics behind the accounting concepts will be over your head. Understanding the broad concepts is more important.

Worst teacher I've had in my life. Learned nothing pertaining to cost accounting. Gives out mostly A's-B's because he has to curve everything because no one does well on the one exam in the class. Pointless and aggravating.

seriously, he got to be the worst professor ever. Don't buy the book, it's worthless and stupid, you will never use that stuff in real life. You get automatic passing grade for just signing up for class. You can get a descent grade if you ask questions about nonsense he teaches, so take him if you don't want to actually spend time studying.

Schroeder is a great teacher.  He is not a Professor that holds your hand and shows you how to work the problems step by step.  Instead, Schroeder gives you lead and encourages his students to try and work through the problems on their own.  To him, this is the best approach in comprehending the material presented in class.
He is a super smart guy. Course materials are really tough, but you will learn a lot about accounting in his class. He will give you a decent grade if you participate in class.

If you aren't that great in accounting, then you might want to take him just for the automatic B.  He teaches mainly  statistics and linear algebra. If you show up, put forth some effort, then you'll get at least a B. If you regularly participate, then you'll get an A. He knows his final is impossible so it doesn't really count toward your grade.
Super smart guy. He can incredibly connect Accounting and Linear Algebra. Grading is based on half attendance half final. Try to work hard and participate.
EXTREMELY easy. The only 522 class where you don't have to work to get an A. Take this guy!!!!

Extremely challenging subject matter, but Professor Schroeder is very realistic with his expectations. He understands that this is "PhD" material, and it's okay if you fail everything. You'll get a respectable grade in the end. Incredibly smart guy.

Too smart for his own good. He comes across very pompous, and doesn't do a good job teaching the material to students. Ask questions in class (don't try to go to his office) and try to participate as much as possible. I was worried all quarter about my grade because I never had a grasp on the material but ended up with a B.

Turn in homework yet receive no feedback. He refuses to meet outside the class and stated no tutor for course however other teacher had one. When studying have to rely on notes and can do problems yet if you didn't take notes in class, then you can't answer them. Very hard. Avoid. Only test is final & refuses to give direction as to what to study.

He's extremely arrogant, refuses to help you at all, and flies through material. He (ironically) enjoys ranting about how stupid Fisher Faculty is, so be prepared. Avoid at all costs- you will leave class in a horrible mood each day. Most egocentric professor I've ever encountered.
One of the toughest teachers at Ohio State..Thought I was going to fail the class but ended up with a B..I think he understands how to take care of students that actually show they want to learn

Best prof&class in the department. I took 525 in spring and learned twice as much as in all my other classes. If you participate in class and do the homework the final is a piece of cake! Also, as a non-native English speaking person I can say that the book is really easy to understand. If you really want to learn sth about ACCT take this class!

I got an A from the course. The textbook is very diffcult to read so you will have to reread it multiple times. Teacher doesn't check HW even though it is suppsoedly part of the grade. Just talk in class.

Hard to say.  Teacher is hard to understand, but not impossible. You have to study and try the homework after class when you get home.  That is the only way to pass the class. Only one grade, the final, but he gives alot of credit for homework and participation. Dont drop him in fear, he will teach you something about accounting.

Honestly the worst teacher I've had in the business school. You can tell he is intelligent but he has no interest in helping his students and can't communicate the subject matters clearly. He seems to brush aside questions by students or act is if you should already know, but the text book is AWFUL!
NOT HELPFUL. horrible teacher.

Has no interest in helping students learn. He is incredibly pompous. He also provides no study materials but the book, which is overpriced and unreadable. I have never been more aggravated and annoyed with a professor. Plan accordingly so you don't have to take 525 with him.

Not as much a professor as a living representation of the text book used for the class.  Outside of his occasional rants about what's wrong with society, he has minimal independent thoughts of his own and chooses to hold his extensive schooling over you.
Take another teacher

This class is about as awful as they come.  Go to every class, write down everything he does for the sample problems then go home and try to decipher it.  Tests are similar to the problems from class.  Going to class and taking good notes is the only way to get a decent grade.

My major beef with this class is that I went to every class, read every chapter, and the midterm and final had maybe 1/4 of what we "learned".  Doug's not too bad, he needs to understand, though, that not everyone loves this material as much as he does.  I bombed the first midterm and ended up with a B, so I can't complain.

I wouldn't recommend him given the choice, but he's better than R. Young. Attendance is required to try to understand the book and get his examples. I was worried I was going to fail but ended up with a C, so either I Aced the second exam (unlikely) or he gave us a pretty healthy curve to make up for the incomprehensible book that he and R.Y. use.
Worst.Teacher.Ever.  If you want to learn nothing go right ahead and take this class

The guys is a nightmare and like others i agree that he is the worse professor at osu. I thought i was taking an accounting class, but i never heard him talk about an accounting terms, its mostly stats. Avoid!!

Impossible.  I couldn't tell if it was the class or just the professor - but I didn't learn anything from him. His teaching style is very difficult to grasp.  I was a straight A student who doesn't mind hard work - I got a D.  The class is more stats and calculus based then it is accounting, IMO.  1 midterm, 1 final, and 5% of grade in homework.

I can't speak to the quality of his teaching, as I was forced to drop his class due to conflicts.  This is my first RMP post -- I felt compelled to warn everyone about this man.  He is exceedingly pretentious, overtly bitter, and explicitly narrow-minded.  FCOB: this most egocentric and ignorant professor ought to be fired at once.

I tried to keep an open mind about him after reading all of the bad things about him.now i realize he is the worst teacher in the business college.i honestly dont know what subject i was supposed to learn.500 level stats? math? i know it wasnt accounting. his job is to prepare us for the next class not read us his publish bs papers.fire him FCOB

I agree with statement below. He refuses to give answers to homework, hold office hours, or really to help students at all. No resources are given to aid the learning process in this class. I would rate him as the worst professor I've ever had by far. Very pretentious, very narrow-minded. By the way, my GPA is a 3.80, and I don't mind hard classes.

First day qoute "Finance is the most useless major at Ohio State." He uses no text, gives no hw, and coincidentally teaches nothing. Rather, be prepared to spend each class flying through masters level accounting. He doesn't post examples or review anything done in class. I rank top 9% in fisher...I got out as soon a I could. Avoid this professor

Schroeder really isn't as bad as everyone proclaims him to be.  He has a different style of teaching, which forces you to learn things on your own and solve problems without being spoonfed the answer--apparently this is too difficult for some students, though.  A strong background in math/stats is recommended.   Not a walk in the park.
Worth professor I have ever had. Completely worthless. Avoid him at all costs. And don't buy the book.
The book is worthless...Don't buy it. Attend every class and try to take good notes.

The only real beef I had with this class is the lack of resources for studying for exams. He does one problem in each class for each topic, and that's all you have to go on, no exam reviews, sample problems, etc. The textbook he uses is garbage, although he frequently raves about it, since one of his buddies wrote it.

Prof is very knowledgable and encourages students to think about accouting from an aggregate, how financial statements are affected, point of view. I learned more accouting from him than from any other prof. Although he discusses some statistics related to accounting theory he does not include that material on the exams. Study his course notes!

He's too smart to teach anybody, especially students at an undergrad level and if you already thought that accounting was horrible than stay away from his class because after this you'll want to change your major.

Has a very different approach to accounting. Not always clear and concise, but usually has a point. Students would benefit from the class more with stronger background in mathematics and statistics, which is more the student's and the school's fault. Schroeder will force students to think for themselves, something most business students do not do.

Possibly satan's brother.  First quiz and midterm were impossible.  The guy only cares about accounting theory and his research.  Not interested in helping average students learn, wants to engage at his level of knowledge not where the class is at.  If you have to take him think twice about it, he is as miserable as they come.

By far the worst teacher in the accounting program.  Thinks the student shoudl learn on there own and the teacher does not have to help at all.  First exam 50% of the class failed.  He teaches from notes that he created himself, no text book, and the notes are impossible to understand.  No solutions
Horrible teacher...rambles a lot and after 4 weeks of class I still had no idea what he was talking about. Avoid him if you can, go with anyone else but him for this class. Boring as hell!!
Boring, hardly teaches the entire quarter, but midterm and final project aren't too bad. Make sure you keep up with the work and you'll be fine.  Will go on tangents a lot about random subjects.

This class was supposed to be in person but we only met like 2 or 3 times in person the entire semester. Did not feel like I learned a lot in this class. Every assignment is graded extremely easily. Disappointed because I was really excited about this content.

Leaves it up to you to decide how much you want to learn in her class. Detailed slides that she just reads during lectures, but ultimately doesn't require participation. Will help you understand something if you ask. Quizzes/exams not hard. Cancelled a bunch of lectures, but I didn't mind. One of the most laid-back professors I have had.
Unprofessional. Cancels class at the last minute and does not provide insight above and beyond the course slides.

Worst professor Ive taken at OSU. Very boring lectures and the exam then is impossible. Reads right off the slides and doesnt bother to explain further when questions are asked. Learned nothing so avoid if you can!!
She is so slow in grading. It can be waiting for one month for just a paper's grade. Her lecture is kinda boring but the exam is not hard.

Her lectures are very uninspired and she literally reads off the slides. Going to class is a waste of time. Her exams and homework are all math based but she does not teach how to do the math. Also, she will randomly cancel class and does not seem like she likes her job at all. I recommend looking elsewhere if you can. Bare minimum teacher.

Would recommend her for this class. She can be a little intimidating to talk to, but she helps when you ask, and her lectures are clear with lots of useful info. Had her over the summer w/ prerecorded online lectures, 7 quizzes, 7 hw assignments, and a big tax prep project. Told us what we didn't need to know for quizzes. Curved A- to A

Taking tax, I was not sure what to expect. Professor Lewis did a great job of explaining things in her videos (Moved to online because of COVID) and would often let us know if we did not need to know abt a specific material for our quiz/HW. Her assignments are fair and genuinely one of the better accounting professors at OSU

She's not a bad person, but very unenthusiastic, reads off the slides basically. Super boring class, just memorizing lists. I would recommend Tax 2 (Professor Wantuch is great) over this class. Overall, she just seems very checked out, seems to be distracted with other stuff.

Professor Lewis is clear and gets straight to the point. Her lectures are detailed and the class was composed of a few quizzes (can be tricky), attendance, a presentation, and a final exam. She is very detailed in her lectures and extremely reasonable/understanding if things end up coming up in your personal life.

Avoid her class if you can. I do not find her lecture helpful considering the questions from exams. Her notes are not well organized and it is sometimes hard to recognize her writing. The gap between her lecture material and exam/homework questions drives me crazy. Always surprised when taking her exam and question myself if I really learn somethin

Tough class but well taught. Don't really use book; lectures on anything that will be on the exam. If you ask about something that won't be on the exam, she'll explain it but tell you not to worry about it. Replied quickly to my email questions. Homework was helpful. Extremely strict about being on time. Cannot take quiz if late. Enjoyed the class.
She is HILARIOUS, THERE FOR YOU, and gives AMAZING LECTURES. You will DEFINITELY enjoy watching her teach. You should never miss a class ;)
poor instructor

This is the worst teacher I have ever met. I am really curious how she get such good comments here. FIrst, she cannot make herself clear in some big important questions. she is such arrogant and when I ask her question, she stops me and go. When i send her email, she never reply me. If she replied me, I would appreciated for her, but not even once.
Stephanie is not the person to take if you want an easy A.  You will learn a lot in her class, and you'll probably enjoy watching her teach.
The worst professor I've ever seen in my life! Her lecture is not helpful at all and she will always surprise you with super hard questions in exam. Definitely avoid her class!

Makes material crystal clear! If you attend her classes you do not need to read the book. She also lets you make a typed, 2 sided cheat sheet on midterms. Also, the class is graded on a curve. But she does not allow you to be late to her class. So be on time!
Stephanie really cares for her students, and I really missed having her for the 2nd half of the semester.  It was tough getting use to another Professor's teaching style.
she is really helpful. the midterm is really hard though. you have to work on it really hard if you want to get good grades.

She was a really nice professor that made tax interesting and easy to understand. The weekly homework assignments were online and were fairly easy. Her exams were pretty difficult but she let you use an note sheet that helped a lot. Make sure you attend every class if you can. Attendance is worth a lot and it's easy to fall behind if you don't.

The class was okay. The midterm was a lot tougher than the final and you can use a note sheet on both. HW once a week was a breeze. I was expecting her to be a lot better teacher but her lectures and notes (handwritten) were very hard to follow and she was all over the place. Not terrible but definitely expected her to be a better teacher and nicer

She was a great professor. She is very clear, grades quickly and even tells some pretty jokes sometimes! She is very helpful and reasonable. She has high expectations, but if you do what you are supposed to do you will be fine.I definitely recommend her

I've got an A- in her class but I've studied pretty hard and went over every single practice problem she gave us plus homework and connect. For us her class had 3 non-comprehensive tests(30,30,35%) and a homework(5%). Test were harder what they should've been, especially those tricky multiple choice questions.

She's awesome.  The quizzes are so easy if you study and for the tests she lets you have a note sheet.  I just took all my notes and typed them up to use for the tests.  So easy.  She's really great, I've recommended her to several people.

Great prof. She truly cares about her students. Make an effort to visit her during office hours and you will see this. Her teaching style is also conducive to actually learning the material rather than memorizing concepts. Take her.

I thought she was a great teacher for the class, the tests were very similar to the practice problems and connect. She wants to help students, the class is semi-difficult, but she makes it as do-able. I would recommend her as a teacher for the class.

I took her for 522, 626, and 636. She may not have the easiest tests, but she is extremely smart and wants to help. If you want to get on her good side, go to office hours and you'll come to notice she is an amazing professor.

Don't listen to the comments below.  She is a very good teacher, clearly explaining the material and very helpful and smart. However the test are harder i agree but fair as long as time was spent on the class outside of class.  Got solid A in the class.

I think she's misunderstood. Though she recites somewhat from the book, the info's important. If you ask questions, you'll see she really knows her stuff and answers in detail. Very responsive by email. She's very professional and a fair grader, so if you get a bad grade, you probably deserved it. If you put in the work, you'll learn and do well!!!

Probably the worst teacher I've ever had. It'll rly mess you up when you realize that you are paying thousands of dollars in tuition just to hear her recite the textbook. Even when you ask her a question, there's still this sense that shes regurgitating something from the book. Message to Brewer: that's not what they mean when they say "recitation"

Brewer is very middle-of-the-road as far as teaching.  She is extremely smart (99th percentile on CPA) but it doesnt translate extremely well to teaching.  She is a very nice person and always lets class out early (sometimes extremely early).  Don't expect an easy A with her though.  I have a 3.6 gpa and struggled to get a B in the class

I took 522, 626 and 636 with her. She is a total menace. She is really bad. Her teaching style is very dull. She doesn't really care about you. She will bring you down if she wants you to. Changed the syllabus during the last week to full comprehensive. She ruins the GPA
Very good instructor. If you go to class and do homework reading the book is not necessary.  Exams are similar to the problems worked in class. Would highly recommend her for ACCT 522!!
Horrible, should've chose another specialization class but due to its my last quarter so don't have much choice. She doesn't care students feelings at all.

I've had Stephanie for 626 and 636 - It's tax so it's very different from most acct courses, but if you put time into studying for exams and understand the homeworks, you'll be fine. She curves the class to a B, and since most people take tax 2 pass/fail you're guaranteed a good grade. good prof, just put time into the course!!

Brewer is a solid professor. Goes through the example problems on the bored. The test is pretty much understanding and memorizing how to do the example problems.  Multiple Choice questions based on knowledge of rules.

She is NOT as bad as the comments below. She did problems in class which were very similar to problems on exams, and was willing to help if you just ask.  Homework is mandatory, as it should be for any 500 level college class.  If you do the assigned homework and go to class, it is not that difficult.

She is one of the worst teachers I've had at fisher. Can not communicate her points clearly, makes a lot of mistakes when doing problems, and very up tight and strict. Avoid her at all costs. If you can, take Katerakis, he is the man.

Professor Kerr was probably my favorite professor at Ohio State. He takes some very difficult and complex material and breaks it down so well in a way that students can understand. His homework's are somewhat long but other than that, I highly recommend taking him if you want to become a tax expert.

The nature of tax is memorizing lots of little details, so there is no way to get around that. However, professor Kerr does his best to make it manageable and if you pay attention in class, you barely need to read the textbook. He is also very helpful at office hours!

Kerr is now my favorite professor in Fisher, along with Marc Smith. He is extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and funny. I didnt do that well on the first exam, studied more for the next 2 and went to his office hours day before exam and scored 20% above the average both times. Great class! Will be taking Tax 2 as my elective

Kerr was the most knowledgeable and well spoken professor I have ever had in Fisher. He's passionate about the subject of tax, funny, and all around nice. You have to work for your grades! There are a few group projects that are fun and helpful. His exams can be difficult so STUDY. Got curved from a B to an A-. I would highly recommend this class.

This is the kind of class where I felt like I actually learned something. Was a super tough class, too many exams (4 and a cumulative final) but he curves at the end of the semester. Good professor, stressful class

Mr. Williams is the best professor that fisher has. He help students brush up their accounting skills but he gave insight on how the auditing career is. I loved that he used real world financials of companies and audit reports instead relying on a dry textbook. He cared about his students well-being. He is better than Marc smith. Gonna miss him

Professor Williams was great. If you go to class and take good notes, you should do well. I learned more from him than any other teacher. He makes class enjoyable and is very fun. He gives great insight into what it is actually like to audit as well as other financial analysis tools. Great teacher.

Really good professor if you actually want to learn audit. It is not just memorizing long, random lists like it could have been, instead you have to really think. Overall good class, but pretty tough.

This was the most confusing class I've ever taken. He essentially didn't teach us anything, he just gave examples and they weren't clear and I always left with notes that later made no sense. Everyone in the class was incredibly lost and tried to supplement with the book but it was hard to know what he would be testing on or what he was looking for

He's about as old school as old school gets. Still uses overheads! But I think it works well for an auditing class. Makes lectures much more engaging. Quizzes can be unpredictable, but he's a pretty fair grader. Class graded on a curve and he doesn't provide the grade cut-offs (only means & SDs after returning graded assignments).

Prof. Williams doesn't generally teach undergrad classes, but he was pretty good.  He applies financial accounting to real life situations, moreso than others.  Textbook wasn't necessary.  He made quite a few mistakes in class, but he went pretty fast.  Quizzes/exams test on a broad range of topics, but he grades pretty easy.  I'd recommend him.

Don't buy the book for his class, you don't use it.  He teaches you how to do real, on-the-job accounting.  His exams may seem hard, but he grades very fairly and curves at the end of the quarter.  Recommended.
Good man.

OK this class is a lot of work yes.  However, he does make you learn the material without the use of the book.  You will be doing some sort of reading of a WSJ article on his exams.  Be prepared because he will NOT tell you what is on his exams.  TOUGH BUT FAIR PROF.
He was a great professor who usually teaches masters classes.  He really knew his stuff and the class seemed to be more hands on than other students experiences.
Great Teacher, Tells you what you need to know and is very helpful when you go to his office hours. If you want someone for 521 he is the one. He is probably one of the best teachers I have ever had

Good teacher that made 521 interesting, but normally doesn't teach this class, typically teaches graduate courses. Best teacher to have pre-522 if you end up w/ Zeigler! After taking 521 w/ him, you would be more likely to be able to perform on the job, not just in a classroom. He doesn't use the book/go by it, & does all his own grading.

His class is difficult but he really forces you to learn the material.  I really liked it and didn't do too bad.  You're forced to understand the methods behind accounting and is not a course based on memorization.  Great Class, I learned a lot!!  Plus, he was a lot of fun and came up with some good examples he was able to relate to accounting.

Professor Geoffroy really does try her best, but her lectures are long winded and confusing. The homework doesnt coincide with the lecture material and she struggles to answer questions, often floundering and going off on a tangent instead of actually providing clarity. I think shes a nice person, but I really recommend avoiding her class.

Oh my lord she is so bad. Sub-par lectures, exams are BS hard, and she expects you to just know everything after saying it once. She really needs to either find a new job, or actually learn how to teach. The fact that the final is cumulative and she does not allow any notes or formula sheets is BS. Whatever you do, do not take Racheal Geoffory.
learned absolutely nothing in this course. do not take with this professor.

Currently taking Acct3200 with her for the Fall semester of 2021 and has been my worst professor yet. Being that accounting is my major, I was hopeful for a professor that had some teaching experience and wasn't just an expert in the field. Unfortunately, Professor Geoffroy is one of those professors that does a horrible job of explaining.

Avoid this professor at all costs. She is clearly uncomfortable speaking in front of groups. God only knows why she chose to go into teaching, but it is astounding that she has not been hit with a reality check. Get ready to read the book because you will come out of class more confused than you went in.

She cares about the class but the quizzes are hard and dont do anything but hurt your grade. She said shed curve the class but that didnt happen. Shes nice but she just reads from the powerpoints and isnt the best at explaining. The contents not hard just be prepared to learn on your own.

She's nice and cares about the material, but not gonna lie, it definitely felt like she made the class way harder than it had to be at times. I barely got an A- after you factor in having two quizzes dropped.

the class itself isn't hard but i think she just needs to work on explaining the material better. she's really nice and a genuine person who loves accounting and wants her students to succeed. people need to giver her a break. the quizzes are pretty difficult but the tests are fair.
Lied about curve, exam material, and attendance component.

If you have a choice, don't take this teacher's class! Although the teacher is knowledgeable, she can't use her knowledge to answer students' questions clearly. Responding to emails is slow. Her lecture was just a powerpoint presentation. You don't know how much of your participation would be, because she wouldn't post it, but it's in the Final.

Do not take her course if you want to improve your gpa. The lecture is useless since she just read the ppt and you could only learn by yourself. The teat is heavy and the curve is bad because she changed.

Do NOT take her class if you can. She just simply read PPT on lectures. When people asking question, she couldn't answer it clearly. Even you attended every lecture, you still can not get full credit on attendance. Three group projects. Quizzes are hard. She provides practice exam, but the average of exam were like 75-80%. Final grade was unfair.

Simply the worst professor I have ever had. She cannot explain material clearly, fails to answer students questions in a helpful manner and has unrealistic expectations for the class. Quizzes and tests are designed to trick you (she laughed about this in class after Quiz 1), and often have typos or information missing. Simply incompetent at her job

Professor Geoffroy severely struggles with delivering material in an effective way, and over-complicated this entire course. Attendance is not mandatory, however homework from the textbook is due every class. She often does not know how to answer students' questions, and her tests have all contained typos and conflicting grammar. Disappointing.

Avoid at all costs. Professor Geoffory should strongly reconsider career paths. She is extremely smart and knowledgable, but she lacks the basic communication skills necessary to be a good professor. When compared to the other professor options for this course, her average grades are 20% lower. She cannot clearly get a point across.

The class is made up of three papers and three python assignments so you have to do well on them. Professor Trimm is very helpful and willing to walk students through anything they don't understand. Attendance isn't required but if you don't attend class you have to write a discussion board post.
Best prof ever!!!! Love him!!!!

Eric is the best professor Ive had at fisher. Class is so organized and extra book problems are helpful. Pay attention in lecture and the class handouts and quizzes will prepare you for his exams. He also cares about students interested in accounting career fields and gave me great advice regarding my major. He is awesome, take him!!

Professor Holzman is awesome!! He is very accessible outside of class and genuinely wants to help his students. He randomly calls on students a few times throughout the semester as part of the participation grade but you don't have to get the answer right you just have to try. You don't need to read, lectures are easy to follow, tests are clear!

Eric is very knowledgeable in accounting and will provide you with career resources and good advice. If you have a problem with anything: ASK HIM, he is super kind and will help. Lectures are pretty dry in person, but you can tell he's trying to make them interesting.

Dont really understand the hate for him. Dr. Holzman was a really awesome guy. He is super helpful during class (although, yes, his lectures can be dryits accounting!) Very understanding and cared for students during COVID crisis. Four exams, quizzes, and a group project. Definitely manageable though. Would recommend him!

His lectures are dry, and he doesn't explain things well. You can get his lecture information straight out of the book. He gives out a worksheet with problems every class which are helpful for the exam. The exams are pretty tough but some of the questions come from the worksheets, practice, and quizzes. He is willing to help you outside of class.

He just isn't a good professor. He takes an hour and twenty minutes of your day to explain material that should only take forty minutes at most. Very dry and boring lecturer, and a cumulative final. Did not do anything to ease the burden on his students during the COVID outbreak and actually made the class harder. You will fall asleep in class 100%
Worst professor I have ever had. Goes by really fast and does not answer questions. Not interested in helping students.

Really annoying to be in his class. He goes super fast and does not really answer questions clearly. He also assigns quizzes and doesn't remind you when they are coming up. There is very little room for error on his tests. If you miss two questions, you are down to a B. Overall, I'd prefer other professors for sure.

He is not the best professor in the world - he can't explain things very well and lectures basically are regurgitated material straight from the book. If there is the option to NOT take him, do it. He's a good person and likes his students but teaching is not for him. Would not recommend to anyone

Eric is very knowledgeable and a good professor. His exams and quizzes aren't easy but he gives you study guides that closely reflect what he is going to test. His lectures can be a bit dry but overall he is a nice guy and wants you to do well and understand the material.

3200 is not a hard class if you have retained the main concepts from 2200. He has two quizzes and two exams with questions similar to what is covered in class. Lectures are very dry but the handouts he gives out are good to study from. Curves the class average to a B. Book problems are usually harder than anything on the quizzes or tests.

Norm is a nice guy, but he is just a horrible teacher. He spends entire class periods reading the textbook and only uses excel in class, but does not allow excel on the exams. His exams are extremely long and near impossible to finish in the time frame.

Professor Norman is a nice person, although you have to put in a lot of work to understand the material. It's true his exams are tight on timing, partially due to the free response formatting, but if you talk to him about those issues, he takes the feedback well! He also curves a bit on each exam. He really does want his students to succeed.

AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS! He is an AWFUL teacher. Like he seems like a very nice guy but is by far the worst teacher Ive ever had at OSU. I genuinely have no idea how this man was hired. His idea of a lecture was highlighting a paragraph from the textbook and reading it verbatim.

Professor Colter might be the worst professor I have had all throughout college. His lectures are dry and lengthy. He does not cover the material on the exams and barely gives you enough time to even format the answers. His last exam had two questions worth 35 points each! If you missed one of those you are already down to a 65%. Awful professor.
Prof Colter was nice, and I could tell he cares about his students. His lectures were pretty long and dry. Reading the textbook will definitely help.

Colter knows the material and he tries, but he's a bad teacher. He doesn't know how to teach the concepts. His logic is hard to follow and he's inconsistent with terms, which makes his lectures even more confusing. His exams are rough because timing is tight, even if you know your stuff. You waste 5-10 minutes on formatting answers alone.

Absolute worst professor I've ever had in my college career. Exams are extremely difficult and short on time. The way he teaches is confusing and inconsistent, and he doesn't teach concepts. Be ready to teach yourself.

He's a nice person, but his lectures are confusing and hard to follow. His exams are difficult, weren't very similar to the homework, and were also short on time. He doesn't really go over lecture slides and concepts and focuses mainly on how to do the assigned homework during class. Overall, he is unorganized and needs a better class structure.

It breaks my heart so see such poor reviews for this man. Norm is a great professor and truly cares for his students. his course is pretty easy if you pay attention during lecture. he has mandatory homework but posts the solutions before its due giving you easy points to help your grade. Norm is a great guy and I would take his class again!!

Get ready to teach yourself. He is an awful lecturer and his voice is awful to listen to. His logic makes no sense and Im genuinely shocked that he was hired and is teaching such a high level class. He is no where near as good of a professor as Marc Smith, Holzman, or Monsen.

Taking Norman for AIS wasnt awful but thats really only cuz the material isnt too difficult. But listening to him lecture gives me a headache. His logic doesnt really make sense and Im confused how hes qualified to teach upper level classes

Lectures are required and very dry. Don't expect to get out early - he will take the full hour and 20 minutes. However, it is not difficult to get an A in this class. The projects can be time consuming, but they are very straightforward and easy to do well on. Skim over the textbook and slides and you will do fine on the exams (which are curved).

Norm is the man. It was his first semester at Ohio State so he was very lenient with the exams and grades. . One really long SUA project worth tons of points. Exams are fairly easy, the textbook was pretty helpful for most chapters and for reviewing for exams. Attendance isnt formally tracked but he will "randomly" collect homework for 10pts each.

Being his first semester here at OSU, you have got to cut the guy some slack. He knew his exams weren't what we were expecting, so he curved ALL OF THEM. HUGE project due towards the end of the semester (took 15-20 hours), but it was SO HELPFUL. Two easy group presentations in which everyone got a 100%. He's a super cool guy, would 100% recommend.

Professor Colter's class is an easy A if you go to class and put in decent effort. There are 3 exams (all were generously curved). There are 2 group project presentations towards the end of the class (everyone got 100%) and an individual project that is very time-consuming (gives you the opportunity to make corrections if needed)

This professor is super super lazy, leting students holding lectures by themselves over half semester. And super tough on grade. Always change his syllabus and never grade students' homework. Always mentions he has been worked for KPMG and how he gets his CPA license to show how knowledgeable he is, but once you take his class, you will find out.

Don't come to class. He taught nothing in the class but still considering himself teaching lots of knowledge. The class is named as accounting information system however, he tests lots of financial accounting things in his exams.
Awful
